name: Beautiful Room & House
space: House: Clean, New, Modern, Quite, Safe. 10Km from the City. Golf course, Tennis courts, bus stop & shops walking distance!! Rooms: Contains one queen size bed with desk and ample wardrobe space. Two windows face the quite street and bring in ample light. We provide you with clean linen & towels as well. Living area: You are welcome to use the upstairs living area which we never use. It comprises of ample seating, and TV set. Bathroom: Share with one other person Kitchen: Breakfast can be provided or use of kitchen for extra charge Backyard: Beautiful clean oasis which we are happy to share. Parking: Ample street parking  Public Transport: 15 mins bus ride from the city. Buses 301 & 305 drop you two blocks from the home. Wireless Internet provided. If you choose to apply for these rooms: please tell us, your age, purpose in Melbourne, and approximately what your daily in and out hours might look like.  Note: There is a 5 year old fun loving dog who lives with us and is part of our famil

transit: YES ! The bus (305,309) is exactly two blocks away and is very frequent
access: Kitchen, backyard, upstairs lounge. We'd like you to feel comfortable so please just ask for anything that you need.
interaction: As much as the guest wants.
house_rules: Prefence would be given females or  a couple
host_about:
About us: We are an East Indian couple in our sixties who are established in Melbourne for over 30 years. We have three children who have now moved out and have found ourselves with spare bedrooms. We have had many guests living with us in the past (mostly students and academics). We work part time and spend the rest of the time socializing, playing scrabble and chess. 
This is a quite house and perfect for someone who wants to live in a green lush and safe neighborhood which is still close to the city. 
You: Must be a clean and respectful individual. We are happy to accommodate academics for longer term period.

name: Room in Cool Deco Apartment in Brunswick
summary: A large air conditioned room with queen spring mattress bed in a vintage apartment. Located right outside is a tram to the city just 19 minutes away. This area is known for its arts culture, live music, cafes and international food.
space: The apartment is Deco/Edwardian in style and has polished floorboards and ornate ceilings and wooden blinds. Your room is large sized, has polished floorboards, a Queen sized spring mattress bed and vintage furniture. The rest of the flat also vintage style with 1940's style tiled bathroom with a shower bath, a groovy little kitchen and a deco style lounge room with vintage furniture and bric a brac. The flat is located next to two major public transport routes. Tram 96 is just 30 metres away and takes you south to the city centre in 15-20 minutes or all the way to St Kilda beach in 45 minutes. Bus stops take you east to Bundoora and west to Pacoevale. The Lygon Street tram line that goes past Melbourne University is 10 minutes walk west and Sydney Road and its great thrift stores, middle eastern foods and a fashion district is within 20 minutes walk. Taxi to/from Airport takes 25-30mins and 50-$60. Traffic sounds are normal for a room next to a main street but minimised by double wind
description: A large air conditioned room with queen spring mattress bed in a vintage apartment. Located right outside is a tram to the city just 19 minutes away. neighborhood_overview: This hip area is a crossroads between two great cultural strips of inner Northern Melbourne.  Located in East Brunswick, between High St, Northcote and Lygon St Brunswick you have the choice of some of Melbourne's best budget dining and cool bars. Restaurants range from cheap eateries to quality Lebanese and Turkish with Indian, Greek, Italian and Thai places. Around the corner Ceres Environmental Centre is set on reclaimed parkland next to Merri creek and it's convenient bike paths. Ceres has a daily organic foods market and two cafes with outdoor and indoor dining. They also have a bike shed where you can buy a second hand bike cheap - or take your own to work on. There are three coffee places within 50metres, and the Lomond Hotel Pub right across the road has good live music and there's also a pizza place downstairs.
transit: Easy transport options - the tram is right outside.
access: Wifi. Bathroom and kitchen is shared but I mostly shower at the swimming pool and use the downstairs toilet as much as I can.
interaction: I'm home mostly but sometimes I may be working when you arrive so there will be directions for you to enter if I am not there.
house_rules: Theres a yoga studio downstairs so if you see shoes out then please keep noise to a minimum :)
host_about: As an artist working in animation and video I am involved in many community related projects. I manage a Yoga studio at this address, downstairs from the flat. I really enjoy Yoga, good food, good company and getting out into the sunshine whenever I can. Melbourne is a great city of arts and music - there's always something on and my flat is in a great location between Brunswick and Northcote, two suburbs with many arts warehouses and venues. Please be aware that the apartment is old yet has a funky vibe - think Berlin - it is not for those who want spick and span modern hotel style accommodation.

name: St Kilda 1BR APT+BEACHSIDE+VIEWS+PARKING+WIFI+AC
summary: RIGHT IN THE HEART OF ST KILDA! It doesn't get more central than this! A fabulous north facing balcony apartment that offers right in the heart of the action location, yet a quiet spot with balcony views and only minutes to cafes, restaurants, shopping, grocery stores, supermarkets, St Kilda Beach, Albert Park Lake, home of the Grand Prix and trams into Melbourne City Centre right on your doorstep. The perfect base for your Melbourne adventure!

neighborhood_overview: A stay at our apartment means you can enjoy some of Melbourne’s best restaurants, bars, cafes, shopping, dining and night life, all at your doorstep. St Kilda beach, Luna Park and the Esplanade Sunday Market are also close by. Spoil yourself at the St Kilda Sea Baths spa during your stay. A 10 minute walk takes you to Albert Park Lake, home of the Melbourne Grand Prix. Here you will find restaurants and cafes that overlook the lake with the city skyline as a stunning backdrop. Our apartment is perfectly suited to those wanting an exclusive, authentic urban residential experience.
notes: First floor apartment with both lift and stair access. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of all the major attractions, and for travelling further afield, trams and light rail are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: Large private room-close to city
summary: Comfortable, relaxed house, a home away from  home! This is a shared house, you will be sharing with me, plus the occasional other guest. Rooms are large so you will have plenty of private space.
space: The atmosphere is relaxed and easy going. You can make yourself at home for two days, or longer, or however long you wish to stay. This is a quiet house though we do like to share the occasional conversation or drink, or even a meal if the mood strikes.  Your room has large French doors that open out onto a shaded porch. It has a bed, a wardrobe with mirror, plus a writing table. There are plenty of sheets and towels. It is right near the shared bathroom.
description: Comfortable, relaxed house, a home away from  home! This is a shared house, you will be sharing with me, plus the occasional other guest. Rooms are large so you will have plenty of private space. The atmosphere is relaxed and easy going. You can make yourself at home for two days, or longer, or however long you wish to stay. This is a quiet house though we do like to share the occasional conversation or drink, or even a meal if the mood strikes.  Your room has large French doors that open out onto a shaded porch. It has a bed, a wardrobe with mirror, plus a writing table. There are plenty of sheets and towels. It is right near the shared bathroom. You are welcome to make yourself at home in the kitchen as long as you clean up. There is plenty of room in the pantry to store food, as well as in the fridge. Feel free to relax in the lounge room, watch a movie, or TV, or relax in the back yard. Guest's privacy will be respected at all times. If you need information and tips on where to go,
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighbourhood – it is quiet, yet close to so many things. High Street, Northcote (hip bars, cafes and craft stores) are a 10 minute walk east; Sydney Road (ethnic delights and great food) is 8 minute drive west; city is 30 minutes by tram or train.
notes: A simple self service breakfast is available – toast, tea, coffee.
transit: Public transport is super convenient with a choice of trams, trains, buses plus walking and bicycle paths. Parking on the street is free. Even the airport is not too far away at 25 mins by car or taxi!
access: You are welcome to make yourself at home in the kitchen as long as you clean up. There is plenty of room in the pantry to store food, as well as in the fridge. Feel free to relax in the lounge room, watch a movie, or TV, or relax in the back yard.
interaction: Guest's privacy will be respected at all times. If you need information and tips on where to go, I am more than happy to help with suggestions.
house_rules: • Respect for our home, for each other, and the environment.  • Please, no smoking anywhere on the property.  • Mindful of water usage - suggest one shower a day and only up to 4 minutes. • Keep the space clean and tidy as you would your own home.  • You are welcome to invite a friend to visit but maybe mention it first. And no overnight stays please! • It is requested that long term stays contribute to some light duties such as unpacking the dishwasher, putting out the rubbish, emptying the compost, occasional vacuuming etc. Creates good vibes!
host_about: Artist, academic, community activist, traveller, meditator, mum ... I love to travel and to share travel tales with people so it has been a pleasure to host people from all over the world in my home. I am easy going and tend to be on the quiet side. I care about the environment and value a simple and healthy lifestyle!

name: Melbourne BnB near City & Sports
space: We offer comfortable accommodation in Inner Melbourne in Clement House, a two storey Victorian built in 1888. Large double bedroom with balcony, private bath and internet access; comfortable queen size bed, TV and radio. The room is upstairs on the first floor. We are walking distance to the bay, beach and tourist attractions in St Kilda and only a short train or tram ride to the City, Tennis Centre, Albert Park Raceway and MCG. Safe on street parking, close to public transport and easy access to and from the Airport. Rates are without breakfast, but we can provide a healthly breakfast as an optional extra, served in the private courtyard when the weather is good. The attractions of Chapel Street are also within walking distance or just catch the Chapel Street tram two minutes walk away. It is a non smoking house with an outside courtyard for smokers. The rate for guests that stay for a week are heavily discounted and therefore very attractive.
description: We offer comfortable accommodation in Inner Melbourne in Clement House, a two storey Victorian built in 1888. Large double bedroom with balcony, private bath and internet access; comfortable queen size bed, TV and radio. The room is upstairs on the first floor. We are walking distance to the bay, beach and tourist attractions in St Kilda and only a short train or tram ride to the City, Tennis Centre, Albert Park Raceway and MCG. Safe on street parking, close to public transport and easy access to and from the Airport. The rate for guests that stay for a week are heavily discounted and therefore very attractive.
house_rules: Are you gay friendly? Yes, we welcome gay, lesbian and straight guests. Smoking is only permitted in the private courtyard, outside the house. Is there a curfew at night? No curfew, guests are free to come and go at whatever time, however non registered guests or visitors are not allowed without management permission. Are you wheel-chair accessible?  No, the bedrooms are not wheel-chair accessible, being on first floor and accessed only by stairs Can I bring my dog?  No pets allowed in the house Are you small-children/infant friendly? We are not set up to accommodate children. Breakfast can be provided at a small extra charge. What time is breakfast served? At the guests pleasure, from 7:30 to 10:30 am Is there wifi in the room. Yes there is wifi in the room for emails and web browsing but downloading movies and videos should be limited.
host_about: Retired Australian traveller, I run a small gay - friendly guesthouse in Melbourne with my partner. We also have a vacation home in France.

name: Melbourne - Old Trafford Apartment
summary: Please note: No booking will be accepted with children under the age of 13 years.  Accommodation is non smoking in apartment & on grounds.  All visitors must be announced during your stay before entering the property.
space: Please note: No booking will be accepted with children under the age of 13 years.  Accommodation is non smoking in apartment & on property grounds.  Any visitors to the apartment must be checked with the owners at the front door before entering the property.   We are a young family of 5 heartily involved in sports & church activities.  We love keeping fit and live on a quarter acre (1000m2) block in middle class Berwick,  We have a large 7 bedroom house which includes a 3 bedroom upper floor apartment (which is where you will be staying).  The main bedroom (Summer Room) has a Queen size bed & base with your own private bathroom, toilet & living area with stereo and 32" LCD TV. A second bedroom (Autumn Room) is available with another Queen size bed for extra travelers if required.  There is also a third bedroom with a single bed.  Add to all this a separate access via an external stair so you can come & go as you please.   There is an in ground pool to cool off in as well as dedicated o

The main bedroom (Summer Room) has a Queen size bed & base with your own private bathroom, toilet & living area with stereo and 32" LCD TV. A second bedroom (Autumn Room) is available with another Queen size bed for extra travelers if r
neighborhood_overview: Our street is quiet & secluded but within walking distance to almost anything you need.
notes: 1. While the apartment is completely separate to our house it is directly above the lower floor where we live.  In normal living situations you may hear some muffled sounds from us & we may hear some from you.  That's just how it is.  This has never been an issue for any of our guests. 2. You will have to use outside stairs to enter into the apartment. 3. You will need a car to get around Melbourne.  Public transport will take you in & out of the CBD but not to all the tourist spots.  4.  Public transport requires purchasing a travel Myki card first. 5. Please keep communication lines open about arrival times and arranging pick ups from the Berwick station. 6. Please note that there are no cooking facilities in the apartment other than a convection microwave & electric frying pan.
transit: If you're arriving via the airport (Tullamarine or Avalon) then you can get the SkyBus to Southern Cross station (where the SkyBus terminates). Then ride the Pakenham Line train to Berwick Station. The train ride takes about 70 minutes.  We can be contacted via mobile from the train or station to pick you up on arrival at Berwick.  Alternatively you can catch the 839 bus from Berwick Station to 100m from our doorstep.
access: All amenities are accessible to our guests including the pool and back yard if it's hot enough. Private entrance for Guests.
interaction: Deanna is always home during your stay for any questions you may have.  We can interact with you as little or as much as you desire.  Deanna has helped in finding rental houses and schools for many immigrating guests in the past.
house_rules: House Rules:  PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING 1. No children under 13 years of age will be accepted in the booking.  There are no exceptions to this rule so please don't ask. 2. Only people making the reservation will be allowed to stay in the apartment.  If you want to make a booking for someone else please ask them to verify on Airbnb & make the booking themselves.  Max 5 people. 3. No extra guests on/in the property without prior permission. Any visitors to the apartment must be checked with the owners at the front door before arrival.  4. No smoking in the apartment or on the property grounds. 3. Please keep noise to a minimum before 7am and after 10.00pm as the apartment bedrooms are above the children's bedrooms. 4. Please maintain and leave the premises as you find it. 5. Please read and abide by ALL house instructions located in the apartment. 6. In regards to the animals please note the following;   - the cats will steer clear of you as you are beneath their notice  - all of the an
host_about: We are an active couple who work from home and have 3 beautiful daughters aged from 21 to 17.  We love meeting people, watching the kids play sport and keeping fit.  Daryl works as a Building Designer and Deanna is the Domestic Engineer of the house and manager of the Apartment.

name: CLOSE TO CITY & MELBOURNE AIRPORT
summary: Easy to travel from and to the Airport; quiet and safe neighbourhood; a spacious and sunny room; backyard for sun baking; a friendly host who are easy going and super friendly! I would like to make your journey more comfortable!
space: My place is great for guest from overseas, interstate or want to live in northern suburbs. If you like live in CBD, this one is not for you, if you are looking for someplace that is between airport and city, have free places to park your car, and like a spacious and quite place for some privacy, or not in rush and happy to travel 30 minutes on the train to city(like us local people do) , it is the perfect place for you. Recently, we have upgraded lighting to LED ceiling lights with adjustable lighting in the bedrooms, we have bought new queen size bed to make the guest room more comfortable.   The guest bedrooms provided here for your comfort is in a two bedroom unit with 100sqm backyard(my green garden). This bedroom is airy and bright with big windows. Your room has a queen size bed and a build in wardrobe, good mattress, good cotton bedding and linen, and room is often decorated with fresh roses from my garden. Bathroom and kitchen are kept in 70's style with colourful tiles .  All
description: Easy to travel from and to the Airport; quiet and safe neighbourhood; a spacious and sunny room; backyard for sun baking; a friendly host who are easy going and super friendly! I would like to make your journey more comfortable! My place is great for guest from overseas, interstate or want to live in northern suburbs. If you like live in CBD, this one is not for you, if you are looking for someplace that is between airport and city, have free places to park your car, and like a spacious and quite place for some privacy, or not in rush and happy to travel 30 minutes on the train to city(like us local people do) , it is the perfect place for you. Recently, we have upgraded lighting to LED ceiling lights with adjustable lighting in the bedrooms, we have bought new queen size bed to make the guest room more comfortable.   The guest bedrooms provided here for your comfort is in a two bedroom unit with 100sqm backyard(my green garden). This bedroom is airy and bright with big windows. Your r
neighborhood_overview: The neighbours are quiet and friendly,  please don't park the car on my driveway because one of our neighbours is doing shifting work as a nurse. There are plenty of space for parking in the guest parking bay and along the street for free.
notes: My mum and Daa's hearing is a bit weak, so please feel free to raise your voice to talk to her. She loves it!
transit: 8-10 minutes walk to local train station, and half hour train ride you will be in city CBD.  Melbourne is a big city, if you don't live in CBD, then train or bus will be the main public transportation.  You can borrow our spare MYKI card to get around for around $8 a day unlimited travel on public transport. If you drive, it is about 15-20 minutes trip from and to Airport, and 30 minutes  (13kms)trip to City.
access: You have access all facilities in the house, I open my home to you! The price is for accommodation and facilities, I do provide tea, coffee and milk to make coffees,  also dish washing liquid and washing machine liquid just to make your travel easier. If you like to have home cooked Chinese meals like fried rice or dumplings, or use of telephone, I am happy to provide with extra charges. As you can understand, they are not included in the price quoted here.
interaction: The amazing thing about being the host is the privilege to be part of some strangers life for a short period of time :-)  I don't live in the house with you, but only 2kms away and more than happy to help if anything you need assistance.
house_rules: I m here to host, you are here to enjoy! Please enjoy the place and treat it as your own home.
host_about: We all travellers on this planet, if my place can provide you a peaceful sleep at night during your trip, then the pleasure is entirely mine!

name: Tranquil Javanese-Style Apartment in Oakleigh East
summary: Study the exquisite detail of the antique Javanese garden wall, or meditate beside the calming fish pond. BBQ on the huge covered deck, also a perfect place for catching some morning rays. Or settle back with a book from the well-stocked shelves.
space: Welcome to Melbourne! The Studio A fully self contained studio apartment within the grounds of a spacious suburban home block, this is a delightful and tranquil setting. Rental includes:  use of the undercover decking with bar-b-que, gas heater or portable air-con and surround  sound music/DVD system looking out to a lovely rear garden with pond and Antique hand carved teak Javanese walled storage shed. Also on the deck is a clothes dryer for the winter months where drying washing is a difficulty. The apartment itself offers reverse cycle climate control, Flat screen HD LCD TV, DVD Player, full insulation, modern shower and toilet facility, washing machine, its own kitchen and dining nook along with all one needs for a short stay in the wonderful SE suburbs of Melbourne. Wireless Internet connection is available for your use. The raised bedroom area has an adequate wardrobe and medium/firm double bed with high quality bedding and dual control electric blanket. When staying more than a
description: Study the exquisite detail of the antique Javanese garden wall, or meditate beside the calming fish pond. BBQ on the huge covered deck, also a perfect place for catching some morning rays. Or settle back with a book from the well-stocked shelves.
neighborhood_overview: Oakleigh is one of the most convenient and diverse suburbs in Melbourne and offers great access to all the attractions. The location offers privacy and security in a friendly neighbourhood, with local shops and restaurants within walking distance.
transit: Monash University, Clayton Campus is a 10 minute bus ride from the bottom of the street just 100 m walk. This bus enters Monash via the northern gate. If you walk to the top of the street, Dandenong Road, there are buses #802 & #804 that travel into the southern main entrance to Monash. Another alternative is to walk along the peaceful neighbourhood streets directly into the Campus 2.7 kilometres - (25  minutes walk to the southern campus gate). Buses to the huge Chadstone Shopping Precinct run every 30 minutes - 15 minute journey from the bottom of the street via Oakleigh Station where a trip to the city central takes 20 minutes Going to the Dandenong Ranges & the famous 'Puffing Billy' There is a bus every hour from the bottom of the street - 35 minute journey. A Myki pass card covers all public transport charges. There are regular bus services to Oakleigh station which takes 10 minutes. By car, it is just 3 minutes to the Freeway/Motorway and you can head off on a grand tour to Phil
access: Please note comfort during your stay is the highest priority. Whenever possible, I will be there to assist in whatever requirement you may have. If you are thinking of having visitors while you stay for a BBQ or just relaxing on the enclosed deck watching TV or listening to the Stereo - It's all there for your enjoyment
interaction: The apartment is situated at the rear of the private house block of land. Access is via the driveway. I live within the main house and you are welcome to entertain family and friends of your choosing within the large interconnected rear deck area. Your stay can be as private as you wish. Your space is yours to enjoy and any interaction with myself is entirely your choice.
house_rules: This is a private and peaceful opportunity that I am offering to share with you. When you come to stay please be respectful of all that is offered and treat it within the bounds of normal social decency. Leave as you find and If there is anything that is, within reason, an issue,  please raise it immediately so I can hopefully rectify the matter. It is my strong desire that you will enjoy your stay, recommend the apartment to friends or hopefully come again .
host_about: Being a 'Baby Boomer' has given me a life full of amazing experiences and this posting has proved itself as yet another adventure. I am well travelled, liberally minded, have a wonderful partner, young in heart and mind, in fine health, enjoy friendly company, a grandfather to 3 lovely boys & 2 wonderful girls , and enjoy my work managing a hollow chocolate moulding factory.

name: Queen Room in Beautiful House
summary: Light filled private room with Queen bed tastefully decorated with desk, lamps and roll down shutters - to keep you cool in summer and dark for sleep.  Situated right at the back of the house and down the passage way the room is quiet and private.
space: Luxury spacious accommodation at an affordable price which is friendly, clean, safe and secure. This stunning property is located in the heart of Frankston on the Mornington Peninsula. Close to beaches, wineries, shops, hospitals and universities. Public transport at the end of the street (approx 1 hr to Melbourne CBD) freeway direct to the city is 2 mins away. Grocery shops, post office and community coffee shops all within 5 mins walk. The Private room is tastefully furnished with a queen size bed, desk, lamps and built in robes.  The house is huge with 3 toilets, 2 bathrooms and a beautiful warm amazing living area - ducted heating for winter and airconditioning for summer. All linen,towels,Internet access and off street parking provided. Would suit professionals, visitors to the area or anyone requiring "quality" short term accommodation.  . name: Très Charming in Fabulous Richmond
summary: I am Melbourne's longest-running host, and go out of my way to make sure each booking is seamless - I pride myself on value, communication and comfort. Quality linen, beautiful furniture and in an excellent location. This apartment has charm, style and everything you'd need for a fantastic stay, whether it's for business, leisure or a romantic getaway. This cosy little flat has hosted 500+ people from all over the world and absolutely loved it!
space: 100% of proceeds from this Airbnb listing go towards the running of the charity that I founded in 2013. So you can feel like a hero and stay at Melbourne's original Airbnb at the same time! With the CBD just 3km away (either a short tram trip, bike ride or lovely half-hour walk), Richmond is the best place to experience Melbourne. The apartment is surrounded by cafes, restaurant and shopping strips (Bridge Road, Swan Street, Victoria Street), shops, boutiques, bars and pubs. Full of natural light, in a very well-maintained building, the apartment is filled with classic antique and vintage pieces.  The guest room is bright and well-furnished, and guests are provided with towels and locally-made organic soaps. We have lots of local guide books, booklets and maps. There's kitchen cupboard space for guests who want to do some of their own cooking, and you're welcome to our impressive array of condiments. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.
description: I am Melbourne's longest-running host, and go out of my way to make sure each booking is seamless - I pride myself on value, communication and comfort. Quality linen, beautiful furniture and in an excellent location. This apartment has charm, style and everything you'd need for a fantastic stay, whether it's for business, leisure or a romantic getaway. This cosy little flat has hosted 500+ people from all over the world and absolutely loved it! 100% of proceeds from this Airbnb listing go towards the running of the charity that I founded in 2013. So you can feel like a hero and stay at Melbourne's original Airbnb at the same time! With the CBD just 3km away (either a short tram trip, bike ride or lovely half-hour walk), Richmond is the best place to experience Melbourne. The apartment is surrounded by cafes, restaurant and shopping strips (Bridge Road, Swan Street, Victoria Street), shops, boutiques, bars and pubs. Full of natural light, in a very well-maintained building, the apartmen
neighborhood_overview: Bridge Road (once famous for discount shopping, now known more for cafes and restaurants) is literally at the doorstep, then Victoria Street ('Little Saigon' - the best Vietnamese and Chinese cuisine outside of Asia) is just a few blocks away, as is Swan Street (the grungier side of Richmond with great pubs, cool bars, live gigs and sports fans from the MCG). The three strips are parallel - needless to say we have loads of great places to recommend - check out the Guidebook in the profile. Supermarkets, convenience stores, delis, chemists, specialty produce shops, liquor stores are scattered all throughout the vicinity. Opposite the famous Melbourne Cricket Ground is AAMI Park, the Melbourne Tennis Centre and Olympic Park - hosting almost every sport you can imagine between them.
notes: Good Apps to download are:  * TramTracker  * Zomato  (and obviously G**gle Maps if you haven't already!)
transit: There are two tram lines right outside the apartment on Bridge Road, both of which take you directly into the city. Extremely conveniently, the #48 tram will take you to/from the Melbourne Airport shuttle (SkyBus) and the #75 to Etihad stadium. On a sunny day, I prefer to stroll into the city - virtually a straight line down Bridge Road, past the iconic Melbourne Cricket Ground, through the beautiful Fitzroy Gardens (home to Captain Cook's Cottage and the gorgeous Conservatory). It takes about 30-40 mins but is an excellent way to see Melbourne. The tram to St Kilda (which goes along the entirety of renowned shopper's delight Chapel Street) stops a 5-minute walk from our door, and the very cool Fitzroy and Collingwood neighbourhoods are just the other side of Victoria Street - a few kms away. That's where you'll find an abundance of galleries, cafes, artists haunts and the amazing Abbotsford Convent (yoga, vegetarian social experimental restaurant, markets, outdoor cinema, beautiful ga
access: #NAME?
interaction: I will be contactable immediately (via phone or email) if need be, but the space is very self-explanatory. I have a local contact if I'm out of the country for any urgent issues (but with over 500 guests and no problems, I like my odds!).
house_rules: The place isn't really child-friendly, so children - as much as we love them - aren't able to stay. The hot water system is smaller than that of a house, as it's an apartment. Be aware that if you have a full bore water pressure shower, the hot water will probably only last 10 minutes, which should be more than enough. Water restrictions have been very strict in Melbourne over the past decade but I would hope that my kind of guests are conscientious of water wastage regardless! All we ask is that you respect our home, as you would expect of visitors in your own home. Easy. Also; if you're going to eat whilst in the apartment, please don't do it in the bedroom (especially on the bed). There's a dining table that's perfect for eating at!
host_about:
I'm 33, open-minded, friendly and reliable. I took my time acquiring a double degree in International Business/Japanese and am now kept pretty busy directing a charity that I founded in 2013. I have lived in lots of different cities around the world and experienced a host of very different living arrangements (pun always intended), so I was pretty well accustomed to this gig before Airbnb even existed.

I like to run, travel, appreciate art, shop, wine, dine, learn Spanish (my wife is Mexican) and love a good board game. I get my kicks from real-life auctions, discovering exotic fruits and vegetables at my weekend farmers market, and meeting interesting people.

summary: Absolute SUPER CENTRAL LOCATION in hip and cool beachside St Kilda! Stunning designer 2 courtyards garden apartment in a small boutique block of only 4 apartments, located minutes to cafes, restaurants, night life, shopping, grocery stores, beach, Albert Park Lake, trams, and Melbourne City Centre.

This stunning home is located in a small block of
description: Absolute SUPER CENTRAL LOCATION in hip and cool beachside St Kilda! Stunning designer 2 courtyards garden apartment in a small boutique block of only 4 apartments, located minutes to cafes, restaurants, night life, shopping, grocery stores, beach, Albert Park Lake, trams, and Melbourne City Centre. FREE WiFi Ground floor 2 bedroom apartment Open plan living, dining & full size kitchen Two private sunny leafy courtyards with outdoor table & chairs Complimentary welcome kitchen, bathroom & laundry starter provisions 2.5 seat sofa & armchair Dining table for 4 Flatscreen 42" HD Plasma TV in living room & 20” in main bedroom Sound system with iPod dock & DVD/CD player Selection of books, magazines, DVDs, CDs Bedrooms with king bed (choice of king or king singles in second bedroom), hotel quality linens, blankets, bed side tables, reading lamps, dress mirror & block out blinds Luxury central bathroom with walk-in rain shower & plush bath towels Euro laundry with washer/dryer Hair dryer, iro
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda is one of Melbourne’s most vibrant and diverse locations. Within minutes you’ll find Fitzroy, Acland and Inkerman Streets. These streets offer some of Melbourne’s best dining and cafes. Walk to the Melbourne Wine Room and Circa @ The Prince for Modern Australian. Cafe Di Stasio for classic Italian. Babu Ji for modern Indian. The Newmarket Hotel for tapas. Mr Wolf for yummy pizza. Dr Jekyll for great breakfasts and snacks. Enjoy great local shopping. Within minutes walk you’ll find supermarkets, delis, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, hairdressers, hip fashion shops, homeware outlets and book stores. Sporting facilities are close by. These include St Kilda Sea Baths, Albert Park Lake and Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre. St Kilda beach and world famous pier are a few minutes away. Enjoy beautiful views from the beach and boardwalk. Or ride a bike or jog along the foreshore bike track or around the lake. Tram stops along Fitzroy Street whisk you within minutes to Melbourne CBD
notes: Ground floor apartment. No on site parking. No air conditioning. Heaters/fans only. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of all the major attractions, and for travelling further afield, trams and light rail are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: Central City Warehouse Apartment
summary: Absolutely in the centre of Melbourne, this converted, open-plan warehouse is full of natural light and character. Easy walking distance to all points in the city as well as Southbank, Docklands, Carlton and Fitzroy. One of a kind laneway experience. Parties, events and gatherings of any kind are not permitted.
space: One-of-a-kind warehouse conversion in an unbeatable city location for shoppers, foodies and culture lovers. See a video of this apartment on the Sydney Weekender website when it was featured by AirBnB. Search for AirBnB and Melbourne and it should come up. My apartment is located seconds from the official centre of Melbourne, yet it's in a quiet lane with excellent natural light. The centre of Melbourne is known for its many laneways which are full of smart bars, cool cafes, art galleries and some world class graffiti art. One of the nations' premier coffee houses, Brother Baba Budan (aka the cafe with the chairs hanging from the ceiling) is located on the corner of the laneway. Gourmet Travellers pick for the nations' best new restaurant is Tipo 00 on the other corner.  The apartment is the top level which is level 2 (Ground, 1 then 2) and is the only residential floor int this building dating back to 1887. It's an open plan set-up with a spacious mezzanine bedroom, separate toilet an

Easy walking distance to all points in the city as well as Southbank, Docklands, Carlton and Fitzroy. One of a kind laneway experience. Parties, events and gatherings of any kind are not permitted. One-of-a-kind warehouse conversion in an unbeatable city location for shoppers, foodies and culture lovers. See a video of this apartment on the Sydney Weekender website when it was featured by AirBnB. Search for AirBnB and Melbourne and it should come up. My apartment is located seconds from the official centre of Melbourne, yet it's in a quiet lane with excellent natural light. One of the nations' premier coffee houses, Brother Baba Budan (aka the cafe with the chairs hanging from the ceiling) is located on the corner of the laneway.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the centre of Melbourne, not just the CBD but the actual middle of everything. Plus it is in a laneway, one of Melbourne's most beloved features with two excellent cafes, one at each end.
notes: The spa function of the bath tub does not work.
transit: Yes, minutes to trains, trams and buses but most places are an easy walk including Fitzroy, the Queen Victoria Market, MCG, Docklands and the convention centre. There is no train service between the airport and the city but the Skybus leaves every 10 minutes and stops just 15 minutes walk away. Skybus offers a shuttle service to city hotels so if you don't feel like the walk tell them you're staying at City Garden Hotel on Little Bourke St which is just 50 metres from the apartment. Skybus tickets can be purchased online in advance which I recommend to avoid queuing. It's sad watching the bus leave while you're waiting to buy a ticket.
access: Guests have full access to the apartment but are requested to avoid the upper level of the rooftop where the bee hives are kept.
interaction: Interaction at their initiation.
house_rules: Whatever gets taken up to the roof must be brought down. Special care needs to be taken to ensure that nothing is left that can block the drains. Do not open the door behind the ladder. No smoking.
host_about:
Melbourne girl, business owner, publisher, traveller, wannabe gardener and dog owner (but not).

Current mission: Pursuing a luxe minimalist approach to life. The pursuit of great life experiences over acquisition of stuff. Digitising photos, music, movies, documents and getting rid of stuff. Travelling, a lot. Thanks to AirBnB I'm 'living the dream' which generally excludes cliches.

As a guest I'm super low maintenance. I'll be happy with a the wifi password and a place to sleep. And chances are I'll have a big list of underground places to visit before I even arrive.

name: By the park
space: Our simple 5 bedroom house is  in a  quiet leafy street in a popular bayside neighbourhood. Four doors away is a large park which features Australian native parrots. Restaurants, coffee shops and cinemas are close by in Church Street, Bay st  and Hampton Street  and  Brighton Beach with the iconic beach bathing boxes  is  five  kilometres away. The  suburb of St.Kilda is  fifteen minutes by car .  This bedroom is the double bedroom which can have a double bed or two single beds in it ( regardless it is an extra $10 per night for the other person) and the other two Airbnb rooms are a double room and a  single room and are on this site and can be booked separately from their sites.   All of the rooms have places to hang clothes and desks with optional computer and  with wireless internet access.  There is a large open plan lounge-room/ dining room /kitchen overlooking  a backyard with huge trees. One small Jack Russell/Maltese cross female dog shares the back porch.   I  am  a  teacher /

neighborhood_overview: Very leafy very safe street 5 minute walk to 711 convenience store, liquor shop, bakery  food outlets, gym  and petrol station
notes: Parking is on the street
transit: The city district of Melbourne is thirty minutes away by car and one hour by public transport /train
interaction: TO GET HERE FROM TULLARMARINE AIRPORT :  Take the Skybus to the city ($16  )and then a train to Moorabbin Station which is on the Frankston line- (14 stops) ( $11 plus the purchase of  MIKI ticket) or take the Frankston and Peninsula Skybus directly to Moorabbin Town Hall /Station complex. ( $30 ) Then either take a taxi down South rd to Studley rd - ($7) ( my street is opposite a 7/11 Convenience store in South Rd) or if you don't have heavy cases you can walk the fifteen minutes from the Town Hall to Studley Rd. If I am home I shall collect you in my car from the station .
host_about: Extensively travelled mother of two adults-male & female. I am an Art and English teacher and paint portraits, read fiction and non-fiction and watch arthouse movies.While Australian travellers are always very welcome I am also accustomed to hosting people from other countries and consider it as my way of contributing to understanding between peoples of  the world.

name: A Room Near the Park
summary: There is one double bed in this room in a house with  five bedrooms.  The other furniture  is a desk and desk chair, a side table, chest of drawers mirror and a clothes rack. The room is s mall but simple and would suit a couple for a short stay.
space: This is a comfortable room for one or  two, in a house with three bedrooms for rent in a leafy suburb  near is a huge park.  It is close to transport, a fifteen minute walk to  Moorabbin station which is 35 minutes to the city and close to Brighton Beach featuring Melbourne's iconic bathing boxes. Please note that a second  guest is $10 per day extra  Help yourself breakfasts are always included! Amenities: - TV   - Internet     - Wireless Int
neighborhood_overview: Safe area. Leafy street beautiful park four doors from house. 5 minute walk to convenience store/ petrol station , liquor store, gym, food stores ,bakery, 24 hour gym.
transit: 30 minutes to the city by car and forty minutes by train.  TO GET HERE FROM TULLARMARINE AIRPORT Take the Skybus to the city ($15)and then a train to Moorabbin Station which is on the Frankston line- (14 stops) ( $11 plus the purchase of MIKI ticket) or take the Frankston and Peninsula Skybus directly to Moorabbin Town Hall /Station complex. ( $30) Either take a taxi down South rd to Studley rd - ($7) ( my street is opposite a 7/11 Convenience store in South Rd) or if you don't have heavy cases you can walk the fifteen minutes from the Town Hall to Studley Rd. If I am home I shall pick you up from the station
house_rules: No smoking inside the house
host_about: Extensively travelled mother of two adults-male & female. I am an Art and English teacher and paint portraits, read fiction and non-fiction and watch arthouse movies.While Australian travellers are always very welcome I am also accustomed to hosting people from other countries and consider it as my way of contributing to understanding between peoples of  the world.

name: Garden Views
summary: This is a small good feeling room with excellent lighting and greenery through the windows. Situated off the living room and kitchen area.  The  bed is comfortable and the desk is large. There is access to WiFi, and all amenities. Large park nearby.
space: Welcome to beautiful Brighton! This is a small but bright sunny room with lots of windows, and plenty of air and light. It has the best feng shui in the house.  The house is in a beautiful leafy suburb by a huge park. It is just a ten minute journey to beautiful brighton beach by car.  See the quaint and classic Brighton Boxes!  There is an option of a  computer for use (with wireless internet connection) on a large desk with a lamp and a comfortable club chair.  It has a comfortable single bed, a chest of drawers, a side table with a lamp and a clothes hanging cupboard.  Help yourself!  In this house breakfasts are always included, after all it's the most important meal of the day!!   For transport nearby, make use of the  811 or 812 bus to and from Moorabbin Station. I also provide bikes for your personal use.The station  is a fifteen minute walk away.   I am extensively traveled ,an Art and English teacher and paint portraits, read fiction and non-fiction and watch arthouse movies.

name: Richmond Super Central 60s Cool 1BR APT+WIFI+AC
summary: LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! Right in the heart of Richmond, this fully renovated apartment is within walking distance of Bridge Road and Swan Street cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, night life, trams and endless shopping! And The MCG is only minutes walk away! The perfect base for lifestyle and exploring Cool inner City Richmond and beyond!
space: FREE WiFi Ground floor 1 bedroom apartment Open plan living, dining & full size kitchen Outdoor space with table & chairs Complimentary kitchen, bathroom & laundry starter provisions 2.5 seater sofa, armchair & footstool Dining table for 4 Flatscreen 40" LCD TV Sound system with iPod dock & DVD/CD player Selection of books, magazines, DVDs, CDs Bedroom with queen bed, hotel quality linens, bedside tables, reading lamps, double wardrobe & dress mirror En-suite bathroom with full width walk-in shower & plush bath towels Euro laundry with washer/dryer Hair dryer, iron & ironing board Reverse cycle heating/air conditioning King sofa bed for 3rd & 4th guests Check-in from 3.00pm/check-out 10.00am Maximum 4 guests Approx 36 sq m The Apartment Super central one bedroom apartment in the heart of Richmond Melbourne. This funky 60’s ground floor  apartment is located right in the heart of all the Richmond action! Featuring intercom entrance, light filled open-plan living, dining and kitchen zone
description: LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! Right in the heart of Richmond, this fully renovated apartment is within walking distance of Bridge Road and Swan Street cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, night life, trams and endless shopping! And The MCG is only minutes walk away! The perfect base for lifestyle and exploring Cool inner City Richmond and beyond! FREE WiFi Ground floor 1 bedroom apartment Open plan living, dining & full size kitchen Outdoor space with table & chairs Complimentary kitchen, bathroom & laundry starter provisions 2.5 seater sofa, armchair & footstool Dining table for 4 Flatscreen 40" LCD TV Sound system with iPod dock & DVD/CD player Selection of books, magazines, DVDs, CDs Bedroom with queen bed, hotel quality linens, bedside tables, reading lamps, double wardrobe & dress mirror En-suite bathroom with full width walk-in shower & plush bath towels Euro laundry with washer/dryer Hair dryer, iron & ironing board Reverse cycle heating/air conditioning King sofa bed for 3rd & 4
neighborhood_overview: A stay at our hip apartment will mean you can enjoy some of Melbourne’s best restaurants, bars, cafes, shopping, and night life, all at your doorstep! With easy access to major venues such as the MCG, Hisense, AAMI Arena and Rod Laver Arena – home of the Australian Open – and the hip shopping and restaurants of Bridge Road and Swan Street. Leave the apartment, head north and in minutes you’ll find yourself in Bridge Road, home to brand name fashion outlets, cafes and restaurants. A trip into the CBD is just one stop away by train, or a short tram ride. Head south and you’ll be in Swan Street. Home to many pubs and clubs, supermarkets, restaurants and hip independent stores. This apartment is close to everything Melbourne has to offer. The place to stay on your next Melbourne visit! Our apartment is also only minutes away from Epworth Hospital.
notes: Ground floor apartment. No on site parking. Permissible sized hot water tank that requires time to reheat water between use, especially between showers. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of all the major attractions, and for travelling further afield, trams and train are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: Kew Tranquility, Melbourne
space: I have a private room available in my apartment. The room is suitable for one person.  You will have full use of all other facilities including excellent wireless internet. In the bathroom there is a washing machine and a clothes dryer. The toilet is separate from the bathroom. The kitchen has a cosy eating area, a gas stove, a fridge & a microware, plus all cooking utensils & equipment.  The lounge has heating, a TV & a DVD player. Off the lounge is a small balcony with a pleasant view over Kew.  Kew is one of Melbourne's older established suburbs where you will find banks, good coffee shops and several restaurants all within walking distance of the apartment.  If self catering is your style Kew offers an excellent selection of fresh food options in the local shops. You can park your car in Pakington, just ask me for the "Resident's Permit". Travel to the CBD can take 20-40 min, depending on time of day. The 48 tram, at the end of Pakington Street (a 3-5 minute walk) will take you int

name: Classic Fitzroy Terrace (w/ cat) - walk to Tennis
summary: A cosy, expansive house in a fantastic neighbourhood within walking distance of the city centre and the Australian Open tennis. Does require some sporadic cat interaction.
space: Our 2-storey Victorian terrace in the heart of Bohemian Fitzroy in Melbourne is available for 1-2 guests for 9 days/nights only (while we're off at the beach). We just need you to feed our cat Basil each morning and evening (and give him a pat if he decides to be friendly). You'll have access to a large home (other than our children's room and our small study). This means you'll sleep in our large upstairs master bedroom, with a comfy queen-sized bed.  You'll have access to a full bathroom upstairs, and additional toilet downstairs, and our well-equipped kitchen/dining room.  You are also welcome to lounge in front our big TV or stereo, or in the peaceful back garden. We are about 25 metres from Brunswick Street, the coolest dining and shopping street in Melbourne, and only a 10 to 15 minute walk from the heart of the city (and an even shorter tram ride). The Melbourne Museum and Exhibition Buildings are just a few hundred metres away. It's a 30 minute walk to the Australian Open Tenni

transit: There are trams in very close vicinity (#11 tram is 75metres away, #96 is 200m away, #86 is 400m away). Trains are only 1km away (Parliament station).
interaction: We may be there for check-in, and then will simply be a phonecall away throughout the stay.
house_rules: No smoking, no pets, no young children.   Linen, towels, breakfast ingredients supplied. You're welcome to use the kitchen facilities, but please advise that you will (so we can keep out of your way, or schedule use).
host_about: I'm an academic (an international business professor) from Melbourne, Australia. I'm in my mid-40s and a non-smoker. My wife Catherine and I became regular users of Airbnb while traveling around the East Coast of the US in 2011. We hosted guests at our house in inner Melbourne (Fitzroy) for about 18 months. We Airbnbed around Europe for almost a year in 2014-15. We now have young twins.

name: Large Bayside suburban house
summary: Ideal location for a family - close to the beach, great local community, only 20 minutes to the City.
space: This is a modern family home comprising of 4 bedrooms (main bedroom with ensuite and king bed, second bedroom with queen bed, third bedroom with two bunk-beds, and fourth bedroom with single bed). There is an ensuite bathroom, another full bathroom upstairs (with bath and shower), and a guest toilet downstairs.  There is an open plan kitchen/dining/family room with full heigh windows to the lush back yard.  There is also a large office, large outdoor deck and garden, and play room upstairs.  The house is 15 mins walk from the beach and 20 mins walk to the train station which can take you into the CBD/downtown and anywhere else in Melbourne. The neighbourhood is quiet and family friendly.

name: Charming house inner Melbourne
summary: This is a great neighbourhood – it is quiet, yet close enough to the city and to so many things such as parks, hip bars and cafés, walking and bicycle trails etc.
space: Charming three bedroom cottage in Thornbury, home of artist/academic. The house is well set up and is very comfortable and quiet. Close by attractions include a large park with exercise equipment; High Street, Northcote (hip bars, cafes and craft stores) are a 10 minute walk east; Sydney Road (ethnic delights and great food) is 7 minute drive west. It is close to trams, trains and buses (30 minutes to the city). Also close to Merri Creek and Ceres Environment park with bicycle trails that you could take all the way into the city.  The house is modest and clean with all new-ish appliances and furniture. Original artwork is everywhere. House stays mostly cool in summer and has central heating in winter. The kitchen is well stocked with everything you would need to cook your own feasts.  The backyard features well established fruit trees. There may even be some herbs and vegetables growing you could help yourself to.  There are several size beds with all the necessary bedding, plus towels

notes: The kitchen/dining area might get a bit cosy with any more than three adults, but there is plenty of space in the adjoining rooms.
transit: The area is well serviced with trams, trains and buses, as well as good cycle paths.
access: Two large bedrooms and one smaller bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, laundry, lounge, TV, off-street parking, and back yard.
interaction: The space will be all yours but you can always reach me if needed.

host_about: Artist, academic, community activist, traveller, meditator, mum ... I care about the environment and value a simple and healthy lifestyle!

name: Pet Friendly Warm Apmt , Clifton Hill, Melbourne
summary: ParkSide Stay is an elegant modern fully furnished apartment that is situated alongside wonderful parklands...The apartment is well maintained with large windows opening to a private sunny enclosed private courtyard garden.  The parklands  are fabulous for recreational use, whether bicyling, dog walking, walking or just sitting in and relaxing.  Restaurants, coffee shops, great shopping are minutes from the apartment...neighborhood friendly and welcoming.  Public transport close by, car parking
space: Come stay at this beautiful boutique, furnished self contained apartment at Clifton Hill, (pet friendly) Melbourne. ParkSide Stay is elegantly furnished and is situated alongside parklands - yet only 4 kms from Melbourne CBD. Best of both worlds a city retreat with a rural aspect. The apartment: ParkSide Stay, Clifton Hill, offers:  a king size bedroom, sitting/dining area opening to a sunny northerly private enclosed courtyard garden, kitchenette, and large bathroom. It has its own private entrance through a courtyard garden into a spacious living area! -Free Car parking outside the apartment. -Dog Friendly Apartment & leash free parklands outside the apartment -15 Minutes drive from Melbourne Domestic/International Airport -Public transport close by so one can visit all  Melbourne attractions such as: MCG/Telstra Dome/ Tennis Centre Federation Square,/Flinders St Station Botanic Gardens/Concert Hall/Docklands St Kilda Beach/Flemington Race Course Closer Attractions – public golf cour

The parklands  are fabulous for recreational use, whether bicyling, dog walking, walking or just sitting in and relaxing.  Restaurants, coffee shops, great shopping are minutes from the apartment...neighborhood friendly and welcoming.  Public transport close by, car parking Come stay at this beautiful boutique, furnished self contained apartment at Clifton Hill, (pet friendly) Melbourne. ParkSide Stay is elegantly furnished and is situated alongside parklands - yet only 4 kms from Melbourne CBD. Best of both worlds a city retreat with a rural aspect. The apartment: ParkSide Stay, Clifton Hill, offers:  a king size bedroom, sitting/dining area opening to a sunny northerly private enclosed courtyard garden, kitchenette, and large bathroom. It has its own private entr
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Clifton Hill is very friendly and welcoming.  We have a very high owner occupied neighborhood which fortunately creates a great sense of community and pride in our properties. For those who travel with their doggies you will be pleased to hear Clifton Hill has the greatest number of doggies in any suburb of Australia.  Thus we are very doggie friendly and restaurants, coffee shops, bars would welcome doggies. We are well and truly spoilt for parks....all around this area are parks and in fact one can walk, cycle, run etc for hours and feel as though one is in the bush.  We have the best of both worlds, a city retreat with a rural environment. One can wander along the river and enjoy a local farmers market most saturdays either at the Abbotsford (converted to a community based environment) Campus or the Childrens Farm... a real farm with a delightful cafe. Smith St, Fitzroy has wonderful second outlets as well as boutique shopping.  Many supermarkets are close by and
notes: The apartment is situated in a friendly residential street.
transit: If you dont have a car there is excellent public transport close by.  Trains, Trams and buses are all within five minutes of the apartment.  Trains are often express to the city and take 8 mins...5 mins to the MCG/Tennis centre.  There is a good bus system that goes to Melbourne University and some of the major Melbourne Hospitals. There are two drop off points for cars that can be rented by the hour, day, week or month(s). Taxi are easily available. Bicycles can be rented close by.... the whole area is surrounded by bicycle tracks.
access: Guests have access to the private courtyard garden.  In fact when you enter the premises via the park, you come through a side gate that takes you into a small delightful sunny courtyard garden (for your use) .  Your apartment opens onto this delightful space.
interaction: I am very happy to assist with any special requirements you may have in Melbourne.  You are welcome to knock on my door or send me a sms. I can recommend wonderful eateries, coffee shops, dog groomers, can provide dog minding and dog walking if requred;  I am also mindful of privacy.  As the apartment is totally self contained with its own private entry you have a home away from home but I am more than happy to provide any local information you may require.
house_rules: Shoes Off policy, come inside the apartment and remove shoes No Smoking No Parties allowed Dogs not allowed in bedroom or to sleep on furniture Friendly house trained dogs only Quiet and respectful to the dwelling
host_about:
Hi my name is Wendy. I enjoy the opportunity of being a host and for guests to have a wonderful experience of both staying at my apartment but also getting to know the area of Clifton Hill, a truly unique part of Melbourne.
I own a doggie who is very friendly, athletic and welcomes other doggies.  However you do have your own private area so if you don't want your doggie to be in close proximity to mine that is not an issue.
I enjoy playing bridge weekly, going to the theatre and the opera...movie going is one of my relaxations as is cycling and walking.
I have travelled extensively and also lived in Europe.  Meeting others is a wonderful experience.
Please be in contact with me about my listing and if you have any questions or would like me to make a booking for any of Melbourne's special ocassions please ask . I look forward to welcoming and hearing from you.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet leafy peaceful street.  Safe area with everything close by.  Wonderful happy neighbours all around.  Public transport within 4 mins walk. Onsite parking provided if you have a vehicle.
notes: Frankston Information Centre located on the waterfront has all you need with regards to brochures on Melbourne and surrounding areas.
transit: Bus at the end of the street.  Frankston station short walk or 5 min bus. Buses and trains out of Frankston station take you all over Melbourne.  Beaches are close by, shops across the road.  Hospitals and Uni's all close by.
access: Guests have full access to fully equipped kitchen and laundry.  Off street parking provided.
interaction: Meet and greet, assist where required.  Guests come and go as they please.
house_rules: Please keep room clean and tidy.  Cleaning lady provided.  No smoking or pets or any extra persons staying that has not been discussed with me. Most important rule is to "feel at home".

name: AWESOME BEACH HOUSE BnB -
summary: Large private bedroom, queen bed, OWN ENSUITE BATHROOM, 2 double wardrobes, wifi, office desk, in safe quiet neighbourhood, includes CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST Shared kitchen. Guests have their own lounge, TV and gas fireplace. Modern home,  close to all amenities, 1 block to stunning beach, 2 minutes walk to cafes, train station, and beach walks. CDB 35 min by train.  Ideal for solo travellers, couples or business travellers.
space: BEACH HOUSE – Awesome home 1 block to the best beach in Melbourne, 2 minutes walk to train station, shops, restaurants, cafes, pubs, with great walks and cycling tracks, very safe area. Modern very clean and tidy home, large bedroom queen sized bed, with your own en suite bathroom and office desk.  Continental breakfast,(self help) fruit, yoghurt and bread for toast, use of tea and coffee making facilities (all day), included.   Lovely lounge and TV area, also great out door space for eating or relaxing.  If guests use (shared) kitchen, they will need to purchase own provisions, clean up and put dishes in the dishwasher. The house has a wonderful outdoor area and BBQ which you are welcome to use.  Or a short walk to a BBQ at the beach available for anyone to use and a covered Pavillion!   Wireless internet. As your host, I am well traveled, hospitable, friendly,  love meeting people, interests include traveling, sailing, cycling, reading, cooking and good conversation. Come stay in lux

neighborhood_overview: Unique neighborhood, that offers within a few minutes walking distance, the train station, the beach, great cafes, two hotels, a wine bar, two supermarkets, a good variety of shops, bakery, excellent walking path along the beach or a great beach for swimming, cycling tracks, and all in all a very quiet and safe area.
notes: The breakfast consists of fruit, yoghurt, cereal, bread for toast, juice, tea or coffee and condiments.  One mountain bike available for guests to use free of charge. Visitors during your stay - only by prior arrangement, including any additional overnight guests. Smoking only outside. No eating in the bedroom. Not suitable for children
transit: If driving, safe free parking is available outside the house on the street. The train station is only two minutes to my house. For the active guests, I have a mountain bike available to get around.
access: Guests may use the BBQ anytime you wish to cook,  Own TV and Lounge area. Also great out door space for eating or relaxing, especially in summer. If guests use kitchen,  own provisions required, as well as clean up and put dishes in the dishwasher. Laundry,  one wash per person per week. Hair dryer in your bathroom. Electric blanket in the winter.
interaction: I will do my best to ensure you have a memorable stay in Melbourne and make the most of our time here. I love meeting and interacting with my guests,happy to share a glass of wine while advising and discussing things to see and do in Melbourne and Victoria. The amount of interaction will depend upon the requirements of each individual guest and their required privacy. As I live in the house,  I will be present off and on during you stay and always there to assist, but happy to leave you to your own space and privacy, you also have available your own lounge and TV area to use, as I have my own lounge and office upstairs.  I have hosted young and not quite so young guests and enjoy interacting with all cultures and age groups.
house_rules: For privacy, guests will make their own bed.  Fresh towels are provided every 3 days. Fresh sheets once a week.  Use of washing machine available, one wash per guest per week.  Guests are free to use the kitchen and utensils, buy own provisions, clean up, with dishwasher for your ease.  Space available in the fridge for your food.
host_about:
I am originally from beautiful New Zealand; home for the past 20 years has been Melbourne Australia.

I love good food, wine, and a passion for traveling, experiencing different cultures and meeting new and interesting people from around the globe. This stems from 30 years working in travel, hospitality and various airlines. I am privileged to have traveled to many corners of the globe, including, Africa, USA, Canada, Europe, UK, the Pacific, NZ, Australia, South America and Asia.

My Interests include cycling, sailing, swimming, horse riding, physical well 
being, cooking, meeting people, good conversation over a wine.
Consider myself to be friendly, social, sense of humor, independent, adaptable, well organised and tidy.
Love exchanging travel stories, ideas and meeting people of different cultures. My purpose for traveling is to experience varying cultures, hopefully improve my tolerance, knowledge and grow as an individual from the experience and fortunate to have volunteered in Brazil and South Africa 

As a Host and guest, I appreciate what I would like to get out of using and hosting with Air BnB.

I will be very happy to sit down over a glass of wine to provide advise on what to see and do while in Melbourne , Australia and of course beautiful New Zealand! 
If guests want minimal interaction I am happy to leave them to their own devises and independence or interact as much as required.

Yesterday is history, today is a gift, tomorrow may never come - so enjoy each moment :)

name: Lovely Apartment with view and cat!
summary: Bright and homely one bedroom apartment on the first floor complete with views. Double bed with quality sheets and bedding, fully equipped kitchen, and ensuite bathroom. Lounge-room has a very comfy sofa bed that can accommodate one extra person.   Very quiet and friendly block that includes a rooftop terrace with excellent views of the CBD.  The apartment is in an excellent location and is a 10 min walk to High St, the 86 tram and lots of great cafes and bars. 15 minute walk to Croxton station.
space: Hullo! I am looking to rent out my lovely apartment while I am away 28th October - 12th November. I also need someone to look after my little cat buddy Mary at the same time so have put the price nice and reasonable. It would ideally suit someone who likes/loves cats and doesn't mind sharing my apartment with one. She is relatively low maintenance and is super cute :)
