name: Stunning Fitzroy, own level + bathroom.  No Ikea!
summary: Welcome to Little George, a light-filled 3 level home in vibrant Fitzroy filled with comfy furnishings and vintage touches.   With Fitzroy's almost 100 cafes, restaurants, live music venues, cocktail bars and pubs you have chosen a wonderful area to stay in.  This is an award winning Kerstin Thompson house and has been my home for 16 years.  I love living here - I hope you'll enjoy visiting, it's nice to have you!
space: Hi there, This listing is for all of Level 3 in my large 3 level home just off the wonderful Gertrude Street, comprising double bedroom, private bathroom, wee study & balcony. (I have 2 rooms available - the other listing is 'Fabulous Fitzroy, Gorgeous Gertrude' listing #150729 on the ground floor). ***Please not I only have 1 parking permit so please check it is available before booking, it usually is but it's definitely worth checking*** This is an excellent spot for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want that 'local feeling'.  Or for those lucky folk who are moving to Melbourne (nice choice!) it's a great landing pad while you look for something permanent. Located in between action-packed Brunswick and Smith Streets, this is a fantastic, diverse area full of great cafes, restaurants, wonderful local pubs, art galleries, parks, live music venues, diverse architecture and the Melbourne Museum.  The beloved #86 tram (our 'tramily') and #12 are just at the end of the road giving
description: Welcome to Little George, a light-filled 3 level home in vibrant Fitzroy filled with comfy furnishings and vintage touches.   With Fitzroy's almost 100 cafes, restaurants, live music venues, cocktail bars and pubs you have chosen a wonderful area to stay in.  This is an award winning Kerstin Thompson house and has been my home for 16 years.  I love living here - I hope you'll enjoy visiting, it's nice to have you! Hi there, This listing is for all of Level 3 in my large 3 level home just off the wonderful Gertrude Street, comprising double bedroom, private bathroom, wee study & balcony. (I have 2 rooms available - the other listing is 'Fabulous Fitzroy, Gorgeous Gertrude' listing #150729 on the ground floor). ***Please not I only have 1 parking permit so please check it is available before booking, it usually is but it's definitely worth checking*** This is an excellent spot for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want that 'local feeling'.  Or for those lucky folk who are moving
neighborhood_overview: One of Melbourne's smallest urban areas, Fitzroy, is a real treasure of old and new, working class and gentrification, historic preservation and modern architecture.  Right next to the city with both the Fitzroy and Carlton gardens in between, it's never boring but very relaxed.  If on the odd occasion it's noisy there are ear plugs in your bedside tables. Diversity, cafes, boutiques, galleries, pubs, parks, restaurants, cocktail bars, music, street art = good vibes.
notes: It's a good idea to check Melbourne's weather report before you arrive, we really can have "all seasons in 1 day" so it's wise to bring something warm even for those summer nights.  I recommend the app 'Weatherzone'. Help yourself to the umbrellas at the bottom of the stairs!
transit: There is so much to offer in Fitzroy you could spend most of your time getting around on foot.  I've left a local guide and map in your room and marked a square around the main Fitzroy streets as a start. The 86 or 112 trams go straight into the city in about 10 minutes, they run so regularly you don't even need a timetable. Hire a bike from one of the blue Melbourne Bike Share stations, the closest to us is opposite the wonderful Smith & Deli at 111 Moor Street, a 4 minute walk away. Taxi or Uber Or if you have a car my Visitor's Parking Permit might be available - first in first served!
access: Level 1 - front door access and laundry (also my rooms and other guest room) Level 2 - shared dining room, lounge, kitchen & 2 large furnished balconies Level 3 - your own bedroom, bathroom, wee balcony & study
interaction: This is a very independent set up.  My rooms and another guest room is on Level 1.  We are all usually out and about enjoying Melbourne so it can be rare we run into each other but I'm always contactable on my phone.
house_rules: - Please call out 'h!' or 'bye' when you use the front door, it's nice to know who's around.  If you're uncomfortable doing this, please don't book! - Please ensure the front door is always locked and gently used - The house is just for myself, my personal guests and my Airbnb guests - It's ok to use the kitchen but not ok to bring home Cage Eggs - The records, the alcohol and the kitchen cabinets with rubber bands on them are just for my personal use - Please respect the check-in and check-out times, thank you :)
host_about:
Hi there.  I'm originally from New Zealand but moved to Melbourne 19 years ago. 
Like most people who arrive in this wonderful city we think we are going to move on, but as soon as we get here ... well, there are reasons no-one ever wants to leave!  I was lucky enough to find this great house in the best part of Fitzroy so here I still am.   I have a habit of collecting things hence all the vintage love around the house.  Over the last decade+ I've shared my home with hundreds people from all around the world.  Things I can't live without?  Friends, freedom, Fitzroy...  If you think my home sounds like your kind of pad I'd love to hear from you and know what brings you to Melbourne.

name: Tamerlane: Architect-designed luxury living
summary: "Tamerlane" is your own stylish and  very comfortable residence on a quiet street, in a funky urban edge location, close to everything that is great about Melbourne. Want the city? It's right there. Want lively, cosmopolitan Fitzroy? You're in the middle of it.
space: This modern, architect-designed townhouse In the heart of Fitzroy is unusual for the area not only for the spacious layout in this 19th century suburb, but also because it is filled with light and in a cul-de-sac away from the main roads.   The house is safe and secure, and has an alarm. Downstairs are two bedrooms, a study, and the bathroom. The house is ideal for a family, or up to two couples - the main bedroom has a queen bed and the second bedroom has a double bed. Each bedroom has a large built-in wardrobe. The study looks out over a small, green private courtyard.  Upstairs is the main living space - a huge open plan area with the kitchen, dining suite, lounge, and patio. Like to entertain? The kitchen is has everything, featuring lots of bench space. The Australian timber dining table seats eight people - perfect for a dinner party, but also very functional for guests requiring more work space than just the study. In the lounge you can sink into the leather couch or enjoy the c

It's right there. Want lively, cosmopolitan Fitzroy? You're in the middle of it. This modern, architect-designed townhouse In the heart of Fitzroy is unusual for the area not only for the spacious layout in this 19th century suburb, but also because it is filled with light and in a cul-de-sac away from the main roads.   The house is safe and secure, and has an alarm. Downstairs are two bedrooms, a study, and the bathroom. The house is ideal for a family, or up to two couples - the main bedroom has a queen bed and the second bedroom has a double bed. Each bedroom has a large built-in wardrobe. The study looks out over a small, green private courtyard.  Upstairs is the main living space - a huge open plan area with the kitchen, dining suite, lounge, and patio. Like to entertain? The kitchen is has everything,
neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is the oldest suburb in Melbourne and a great example of why Melbourne is regularly called the world's most livable city.  Fitzroy has very diverse residents; shops; bars, cafes and restaurants; all services; and interesting streetscapes. There are beautiful parks and gardens nearby, plus museums and galleries. It's very walkable and bike friendly. Most buildings are low rise, one or two stories, even though its only ten minutes walk to the centre of the city. In the Guidebook I have listed a few on my favourite local places - though I'm sure you'll find your own just by wandering around. Sometimes these inner city neighbourhoods can be noisy, but the townhouse is in a street with very little through traffic. During the day there is some activity because the house borders an office and commercial precinct.
notes: There is a printer and a scanner which you can use, subject to a fair use policy. Please see the Guidebook for more details after you make your booking.
transit: Public transport is excellent - three tram routes within a few minutes walk, and a CBD train station ten minutes walk to take you anywhere in the city. There are two Myki cards (the local public transport smart card) for guest use (these need to be recharged in a local shop). There is no on site parking, but there is unrestricted street parking in front of the house. The main car rental offices are 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes taxi ride in the central city.   From the airport, if you are not coming by taxi, the Skybus takes you to Southern Cross Station in the city where you can transfer onto one of the three tram routes, which are one minute walk from the station.
access: "Tamerlane" is all yours! You will have all the essentials - wifi, coffee and tea, condiments, shampoo, soap and conditioner in the bathroom, laundry and dishwashing detergents, umbrellas. There is a Nespresso coffee maker, with two Nespresso stores nearby in the city for extra supplies.
interaction: I will always be available via the AirBnB site to answer questions or resolve any issues during your stay.
house_rules: Respect the house and your residential neighbours.  - Please leave the house as you find it. - No parties, loud noise, or gatherings of non-residents.  - No loud noise after 10.00 pm or before 8.00 am.  - No smoking or pets. - No shoes in the house - enjoy the comfort of socks or bare feet!  - Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen and bathroom.  - Please water the upstairs and downstairs gardens. Thanks  ...
host_about: I've lived in Melbourne all my life - well, almost. I'm semi-retired and frequently go travelling. Since I've had such great experiences with AirBnB, I thought it was only natural that I list my home for visitors to Melbourne.

name: City Location-Perfect for Singles
space: Located in the city (the north end), this apartment is on the 18th floor of the modern Milano Apartments, in a prime position to experience Melbourne and all it has to offer. It is less than a 2 minute walk from the Victoria market and the Italian restaurant precinct of Carlton. Trams stops are located at each end of the street and the Melbourne Central train station is one block away. You can take trams and trains to get you all over Melbourne. Also in very close proximity is the State Library and the Old Exhibition buildings containing the IMAX picture theatre. If you like sport and want to check out an Australian Rules Footy match my apartment is easy walking distance to the biggest stadiums in Melbourne, including the tennis centre.The apartment is surrounded by cafes, shops, bars, pubs, boutiques and restaurant strips. Aldi is located at the bottom of the building.  The Milano Apartment complex includes a Tennis court, pool, a massive gymnasium, sauna and spa all of which are avai

neighborhood_overview: The City of Melbourne is your neighborhood so enjoy it .
transit: I have a Myki available for you. It will have some money on it ready for you to use and I would appreciate it if you could put some money back on it in readiness for the next guest according to your own usage. I have a 150CC Vespa that I can rent to you at $20 per day.
access: All amenities in and around the apartment. Pool,Spa, Suana and Gym are all available from 6am to 10 pm 7 days per week
interaction: I live in the apartment and have a full time job so in the evenings I am occasionally out. Weekends I can be anywhere. If I am going out to a movie or a dinner I am happy for you to join me and i will offer you an invitation..
house_rules: Simply.... respect of my home and belongings. If you are not home please leave the door slightly open so that I know that I can turn up the music and move around the apartment freely. If your door is closed I will assume that you are resting or sleeping and I will therefore be very quiet.
host_about:
Hi there, I  consider myself an expert on all matters Melbourne. I was born in Melbourne and know many of its so called "secret spots".

I work in the executive management field,. I speak Italian and I love meeting people from different parts of the world.I love cooking,working hard at keeping fit and most importantly having a good laugh !
 
If you know nothing about Melbourne I am more than capable of personally helping you with tours and travels in and around Melbourne. I regularly get down to the west coast along the Great Ocean Road and would be happy to take along for the ride.

name: Northcote, A Classic in Melbourne
summary: A relaxed Californian bungalow with a mature garden. Your room is large with high decorative ceilings. With access to kitchen facilities and your own bathroom, this is just the space you need to settle into while you explore the surrounding areas.
space: Northcote is a great suburb to hang out, with easy access to the city. It is a great place to base yourself and discover the many delights that the inner suburbs of Melbourne hold for those travellers who like to checkout the local, rather than the tourist scene.   Our large house is situated in the popular suburb of Northcote.  High st, Northcote, one of the main streets in the area is within easy reach of our house and features some great cafes and bars. With live music acts, both local and international playing regularly, it is sure to suit all ages.  Station st, Fairfield is also within walking distance and contains many eclectic retailers and some lovely cafes/restaurants. Public transport is easily accessible with the 86 Tram, that runs through the City to Docklands and the 112 tram which (email hidden), St Kilda. Both Hurstbridge and Epping Train lines go to and from the City and are both within walking distance. The 508,250 and 251 buses all within a stones throw from the house

house_rules: • Check-in time is 2PM. No smoking is allowed in the house/room.  Smokers are however welcome to smoke in the rear garden if they wish. Breakfast will be laid out  every morning unless we agree otherwise.  Please tidy away your dishes when finished. Its OK to come and go whatever the time but please try to be as quiet as possible if you are coming home after midnight. Above all be friendly.

name: Blissful Beachside Port Melbourne Warehouse
summary: Your own stylish, spacious bedroom and bathroom - plus shared use of the whole house - in a large, lofty, one-of-a-kind town home carved out of a 150-year-old landmark factory building. Ideally located in trendy Port Melbourne, with easy parking right out front. Just half a block from the beach - 3 blocks to ferry & cruise departures or the local tram stop - and 10 easy minutes by tram to the heart of Melbourne.  Whole house occasionally available. Pls enquire.

neighborhood_overview: Port Melbourne is one of Melbourne's most sought-after inner enclaves - a salty-aired, breezy, resort-like bayside neighbourhood - yet just 10 minutes by tram from the centre of the city.  Formerly a rough-edged wharfie zone, today Port is a delightful mix of high and low, old and new, teeming with quirky cafes, every flavour of restaurant or pub and shops of all kinds. Plus the beach, with its kilometres of bike and walking paths meandering along the waterfront, is just a few steps from my front door.  But what makes my 'hood' a truly special place to stay...  Well, if you like a real neighbourhood, not just a location, you'll love Port. It's a friendly, bustling place where Vince the barista extraordinaire  learns what coffee you like and has it ready for you before you ask - folks say hi as you run (or stroll) along the beach - and neighbours drop by for a natter. Come stay and see why my neighbours and I wouldn't live anywhere else!
notes: The whole house, suitable for 4-5 guests, may occasionally be available for the right guests at the right time. Please contact me if you're interested.
transit: Couldn't be easier! The tram and 10-minute access to the city is just a few blocks away, with guest metro passes available at the tram stop. Plus rent-a-bikes just out the front door. And easy walking to neighbourhood and bayside delights.
access: Access as much of my home as you like. Share the lounge, the kitchen, the courtyard with me if you like to hang out. Or stick to your own private room and bath if that's what you prefer. Expansive common area grounds, gym and pool are also yours to enjoy.
interaction: In my place, it's really up to you.  I've had quiet guests with their own plans who prefer to keep to themselves. And gregarious ones who jump in and live the local life with me and my congenial neighbours. All are welcome, always on your own terms.
house_rules: Pets possibly allowed - but you must contact me to discuss first. (Depends on how they're likely to get on  with resident top dog Boof!) No smoking inside please.   Other than that, I'd ask only that you keep shared areas tidy and be as respectful of my home as I would of yours.
host_about:
I'm a once-upon-a-time New Yorker, transplanted to Australia almost 30 years ago for a one-year assignment, and never looked back. 

I now work from home running my own marketing consulting and creative services business. And my place is a frequent stopping off point for friends from around the globe - or for neighbours just dropping by on the way home from the tram. 

If you stay with me, you'll find an easy-going home away from home here. I'll show you where everything is, you can help yourself any time, and feel welcome to join in for a drink or a chat. Or if you prefer to stay to yourself, that's cool too.

And - if you let me stay in your home, you can be sure I'll treat it with the same care I hope for from guests in my own house.

name: City's edge Penthouse - private bath, views!
summary: Private room ideal for solos or couples. Queen size bed, TV, fast WiFi, Netflix and a private bathroom in a central, quiet, secure top floor apartment.  Ducted A/C & heating throughout.  Tram stop and IGA supermarket 40 metres from the door.
space: Welcome to historic South Melbourne! Safe comfortable accommodation for maximum 2 people.   Your room is in a large top floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with secure entry. It is just 2 km (1.2 miles) from the city centre, 2.5 km from St  Kilda, 1.5 km from South Melbourne beach, and walking distance through parkland to the MCG and Rod Laver Arena.   Your Room There is an exceptionally comfortable queen size bed, your very own private bathroom and separate toilet.  All bed linen and towels are supplied, including beach towels for the pool or beach. There's also a hairdryer, bathrobes, snuggly rugs and chiropractic pillows.  You will have stunning panoramic views over South Melbourne, Port Phillip Bay and Albert Park from every room. You can watch the ferry leave for Tasmania at sunset, or see hot air balloons at sunrise. How to Get Here Take Skybus from the airport to Southern Cross Station, then a short uber or tram ride to mine. MYKI cards are supplied for public transport, just

Tram stop and IGA supermarket 40 metres from the door. Welcome to historic South Melbourne! Safe comfortable accommodation for maximum 2 people.   Your room is in a large top floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with secure entry. It is just 2 km (1.2 miles) from the city centre, 2.5 km from St  Kilda, 1.5 km from South Melbourne beach, and walking distance through parkland to the MCG and Rod Laver Arena. You will have stunning panoramic views over South Melbourne, Port Phillip Bay and Albert Park from every room. You can wat
neighborhood_overview: Clarendon Street is a 5 minute walk and has something for everyone - beautiful wide streets and footpaths, cobblestone lanes, restaurants, cafes and bars, eclectic shopping, a great market.  It's much more local and friendly, and still within walking or tram distance of the city.
notes: NO cleaning fees. Early (8am-1pm) check in,  or late (11am-4pm) pm) check out incurs an extra charge of $20. Directions for arrival will be sent following booking confirmation.  More detailed information is also available on arrival, along with Myki PT cards and WIFI password.
transit: Catch a #58 tram at my door step to take you straight to Melbourne Convention Centre,  Southbank and Crown Casino, the Aquarium, the city centre, then on to Queen Victoria Market and even Melbourne Zoo.  Hop off at the river for a waterside walk to Exhibition Centre, South Wharf.  Here there is plenty of shopping and restaurants. The domain interchange tram stop is just two minutes away, where you can catch trams to almost anywhere in inner Melbourne.  It's just a ten minute ride to almost everything - for the city, Federation Square, Southbank and major sporting venues, take any tram northbound.  For St Kilda it's #16, Chapel Street #6, Toorak Road #58 south bound. For drivers, it's two minutes to Citylink, twenty to the airport.   Street parking is free overnight and on weekends.
access: Amenities  For breakfast, you're welcome to help yourself to tea/coffee, cereal and home made bread for toast. For those who like to cook, you have full use of the kitchen, or there are plenty of restaurants, cafes and pubs close by for those who don't!    A supermarket and bottle shop is a handy 50 metres away.   There's a mini barbecue on the balcony too. A laundry with large washer, dryer and laundry products is available to freshen up those travel clothes. Fast WiFi is included and available through the whole apartment.  A 42" flatscreen TV is in your room. Other bonuses are a heated pool, tennis court (two racquets available) and a gym. And just in case it rains (in Melbourne??) there are plenty of new and old movies, books, Kindle and audio books for your phone/ipad and board games to keep you entertained.
interaction: Guests are free to utilise the whole apartment, except of course my bedroom and ensuite.   You can call, email or message me if you need. I am home most nights, watching a favourite TV series or a movie. You're welcome to join me on the couch for a glass of wine or a cuppa.
house_rules: Please respect my home by keeping it clean and using the amenities sensibly.   Turn off lights and fans when not in use. Shoes off inside please. Please eat at the dining room table, not in the bedroom. Early checkins or late checkouts are negotiable for a fee. Please be careful not to let suitcases scratch the walls. I do have to work during the week, so quiet homecomings if you are late on week nights. Please note this is a pet and child free zone. Smokers are welcome to use the balcony.  If it's really cold out there, we have blankets. :)
host_about:
Host and traveller since 2011. 
You will love  Melbourne and staying in  my relaxed eclectic  apartment.
I've Airbnb'd in London, Paris, New York,  Seminyak, Barcelona,  Seattle, Venice, Ho Chi Min and more, so I understand both sides od Airbnb.
 I've had a few adventures and glitches on the road too, and of course the best part, meeting and staying with many different people.

name: 2 bedrooms-ideal for friends/family
summary: Very comfortable modern, house in quiet, leafy environment with easy access to local shops and all public transport-bus,tram,train and access to freeways for country driving.
space: Lovely townhouse offering two rooms; One with a queen bed in spacious room with plenty of wardrobes; the other room has a double bed and also has plenty of wardrobe space. Both share one large bathroom and all are situated on the first floor. Ideal for family group or friends travelling together. Quality towels, linen, soaps. Hair dryer provided. If you only want one room that is fine: I won't put someone else in the other. I have the second floor with separate ensuite to guests.  No children under five please. Breakfast - I always have bread, cereal, tea and coffee. I find a lot of guests like to bring their own particular favourites which is fine, I don't mind you using the kitchen for simple cooking. Also part of many guests' stay is their enthusiasm to sample the wide variety of excellent local cafes for breakfast. The suburb of Prahran is located south east of the city (45 minutes walk - 10 minutes by train) in a prime position to experience Melbourne and all it has to offer. Just

neighborhood_overview: The suburb of Prahran is located south east of the city (45 minutes walk - 10 minutes by train) in a prime position to experience Melbourne and all it has to offer.  Just a two minute walk to the railway station, and trams and buses at each end of the street.  Just a couple of minutes walk to the famous and vibrant district for shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs, boutiques of Greville and Chapel Streets.  Easy walk to the Alfred Hospital if you are visiting patients.
notes: I like my guests to be out and about enjoying Melbourne and am pleased to offer suggestions and advice.
transit: Just a two minute walk to the railway station, and trams and buses at each end of the street.
access: Guests have access to kitchen to store food and the microwave for quick heat ups.  There are so many wonderful cafes and restaurants close by it's not necessary to cook.
interaction: Guests are welcome to ask for help and suggestions of what's on.
house_rules: You are welcome to relax and feel at home. Please feel welcome to seek advice, directions and to ask for assistance during your stay Please keep the front gate closed and remember to lock the front door. Remove your shoes inside the house.  No smokers please. Simply.... respect my home and belongings and doggies.
host_about: Hello! I'm Melbourne born and bred so will be delighted to help you on your visit.

name: Richmond Central Parkside 1BR APT+PARKING+WIFI
summary: ABSOLUTE SUPER CENTRAL RICHMOND LOCATION! Walk to hip and happening Bridge Road cafes, restaurants and nightlife. Enjoy the local park, swimming pool and the Fabulous Gleadell Street Weekend Farmers' Market for fresh off the farm produce! Also within walking distance, gourmet groceries, supermarkets and trams that whisk you into Melbourne City Centre within minutes!

Less than 3km from Melbourne city centre. With intercom entrance, light filled open-plan living, dining and kitchen zones. Full size timber kitchen, breakfast bar, elect

neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to Bridge Road and Swan Street, where you’ll find great restaurants, bars, cafes, supermarkets, shopping and night life. Walk to 1000 Blessings, a fab organic cafe and enjoy great coffee and food. Enjoy the Weekend Farmers’ Market,bursting with fresh produce and loads of atmosphere. Richmond Recreation Centre, with gym and 50 metre indoor pool and a large park with BBQ areas, playground and oval are all just around the corner. Hop on a tram and in minutes you’ll be in the heart of Melbourne city or in trendy Chapel Street South Yarra with its endless shopping options. There’s easy access to Melbourne’s major venues – the MCG, Hisense and AAMI Arenas and Rod Laver Arena – home of the Australian Open. This apartment is close to all Melbourne has to offer and is famous for. Definitely the place to stay! Also only minutes away from Epworth Hospital and The Melbourne Clinic.
notes: Second floor apartment without lift access. No air conditioning. Heaters/fans only. Permissible sized hot water tank that requires time to reheat water between use, especially between showers. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of all the major attractions, and for travelling further afield, trams are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: 1950s Apartment, St Kilda East
summary: Greyfriars is an iconic apartment block with a beautiful central garden, a car park and our sunny 1950s renovated one bedroom flat. Green views from living and bedroom, a cute separate kitchen and a retro bathroom.  Walk to shops, tram to city. Your pied-a-terre in vibrant Melbourne.
space: Retro one bedroom apartment for two in East St Kilda.  A beautiful garden, your own car space and trams to St Kilda and the city from this treed residential neighbourhood. The apartment has a well equipped kitchen with a cafe table and chairs. The original bathroom has a shower over the bath, new toilet and hand basin, thick towels, soap and shampoo.   A good sized bedroom houses a comfortable queen bed.  Quality linen is supplied with a selection of cotton or woollen blankets or a doona. The bedside tables are vintage marble and brass. The 1950s glam lamps are a useful frivolity.  A built in wardrobe, a cheval mirror, lady's chair, a chest of drawers and a towel rack complete the room.  The living room has a large marble topped dining table with four bentwood chairs.  There is a leather sofa, side table, a bookshelf with books about Melbourne and Australia amongst others, and a television.  There is a reading chair and a floor lamp near the wide windows. A vintage sideboard has a lamp

Green views from living and bedroom, a cute separate kitchen and a retro bathroom.  Walk to shops, tram to city. Your pied-a-terre in vibrant Melbourne. The apartment has a well equipped kitchen with a cafe table and chairs. The original bathroom has a shower over the bath, new toilet and hand basin, thick towels, soap and shampoo. The 1950s glam lamps are a useful frivolity.  A built in wardrobe, a cheval mirror, lady's chair, a chest of drawers and a towel rack complete the room.  The living room ha
neighborhood_overview: Greyfriars is an iconic 1950s apartment block built near the top of East St Kilda hill.  Stately mansions like Labassa and Grimwade House are a stones throw away.  The area is green and residential but a walk, a tram or a short drive away, is all the action of Balaclava, Ripponlea and Elsternwick. Stroll down Orrong Road to Glover Station, our favourite eatery in Glen Eira Road or to Ripponlea Village for a fabulous brunch.  Walk down the Balaclava Road hill to eclectic Balaclava with its cafes, restaurants, bakeries and shops.  And tram back up the hill if you are feeling lazy. The St Kilda Esplanade, Luna Park and Ackland Street are a short tram ride away on the no 16 or 3A trams. Enjoy the tram a little longer and you are in Melbourne's CBD on either the no 16, 3 or 3A.  (The no 3 takes you to the City via a different route to Ackland Street and St Kilda Beach) Alternatively you can take the train from Balaclava Station to the city or the MCG. Feel like seeing a movie? Scoot along t
notes: If you are staying at Greyfriars for three months, we offer you a free two nights at Satis Beach House, Aireys Inlet to experience some surf coast sea air.
transit: The tram is just outside the apartment gardens.  Enjoy the rides! The 220 bus travels regularly up and down Orrong Road to the city and beyond via Malvern Road, South Yarra crossing Chapel Street to the Prahran Market. And we will leave a Myki card for you with a few dollars worth of transport. Just load it up at a newsagents to travel more on trams, buses and trains around Melbourne. Greenmeadows Gardens is around the corner and is a popular, leafy park for families and those just wanting to sit and read or walk their dogs.  Of course, Greyfriars has a lovely garden to relax in too. Markets on weekends like the famous St Kilda Esplanade Sunday Market and the Hank Marvin Markets in Alma Park are a weekend event with food trucks, produce and craft stalls. South Melbourne, Prahran and the famous Victoria Market in the city are all great places to buy fresh produce and to explore during the week too.
access: The apartment is all yours and this includes the lovely garden with fresh herbs for picking, a communal laundry with washers and driers, large rubbish bins. The car park and garden are all accessible for your time here.  There is also plenty of free street parking just outside.
interaction: You will have the apartment to yourselves.  We will meet you when you arrive to show you around and we are only an email or phone call away if you need us.  The other apartment owners are friendly and will help if needed.  We will also give you contact numbers for emergencies.
house_rules: We hope that you enjoy your time in our apartment and we are sure that you will treat it with respect. The apartment block is not a party block so noise including loud music after 10pm is to be avoided.  Only one or two people are allowed to stay and you are expected to treat Greyfriars with respect, of course. There is a large communal laundry with coin in the slot washers and driers that can be accessed most of the time.  Please see the information sheet.
host_about:
We live on a broad acre farm on the Wimmera plains, enjoying the space, wildlife and the ability to grow our own produce. Our beach house on the Great Ocean Road is a total contrast to life on the farm. 

Satis Beach House is comfortable, quirky and just around the corner from a beautiful surf beach, estuary and cliff top walks along the coastline of southern Australia.  Excellent cafes, restaurants, bookshops and galleries add to the coastal mix at Aireys Inlet.

Greyfriars is a 1950s apartment block with a lovely central garden in St Kilda East, Melbourne. We invite guests of Satis Beach House and others to stay at our cute one bedroom apartment and live like a local in this fascinating suburb for a stay of four weeks or more.  

Anyone who stays at Greyfriars for three months, may have two nights at Satis Beach House as our guests. Check out our Greyfriars Airbnb page for details.

name: Studio apartment on Collins Street
summary: Boutique city living in the centre of the city. Art Nouveau features, historic heritage building and modern class. This 4th floor apartment is moments away from Bourke Street shopping, the Emporium, Federation Square, theatres, bars, cafes, trams(free in the CBD) and Flinders Street Station. Quiet entry in Manchester Lane.

neighborhood_overview: Centre of the City of Melbourne. The Laneway's, the Theatre's, the Galleries and the best shopping in Australia. The 'new' Myer Emporium, H & M, Bourke Street Mall, close to the river, the Casino and the Botanical Gardens.
notes: When booking flights please note that check in can be no later than 6.00pm. Thank you
transit: Trams at the door. Hire a bike. Book the Airport Bus directly to the door in Collins Street.  All public transport is free in the CBD.
access: All amenities are available for the guest/s. No sharing.
interaction: I will meet all guests on arrival and provide information on Melbourne and surrounding area. Always available by phone if needed, but I like to give all guests complete privacy when staying in my apartment
house_rules: No smoking.  Please respect my belongings and leave the apartment in the state it was handed to you in.  Please respect my neighbours and avoid playing loud music. This includes no parties.  If you are planning on arriving during a week day - I work close by and am quite flexible with check in, but occasionally you may have to wait a little in the gorgeous coffee/chocolate shop out front in Collins St.  Check in and check out - I am very flexible and happy to accommodate.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Malcolm. 
I live and work in Melbourne. I work in the Arts & Design sector in this wonderful city. I enjoy hosting people from all over the world in my apartment. 
Some things I love: art, sculpture, cooking, gardening, writing, reading, markets, designing, hosting people, restaurants, sailing, golf, galleries. Traveling when I can! 
If you would like to know more, please just ask.

name: Double Guest Room Ensuited
summary: We are a registered accommodation provider and use professionally laundered linen and the building meets all fire regulations. Newly purpose built guest room with private bathroom.
space: The Guesthouse The property is located right across from beautiful Albert Park Lake 1km away from Melbourne City Centre.  It offers 12 guest rooms with a large common area complete with dining room. Guests have complimentary use of kitchen facilities during office hours. The guesthouse is homely and all rooms are decorate in neutral colors. If you walk any direction for 2 minutes, you will reach a tram stop that will take you to almost anywhere in inner Melbourne.Royal Botanic Gardens and Eureka Tower are both close by, while Federation Square is one of the local area's attractions. Also nearby are Melbourne Cricket Ground and Etihad Stadium.  The Rooms All guest rooms have their own bathroom, furnished with desk, digital tv and dvd player. Continental breakfast can be provided for an additional cost.  The Atmosphere As all

name: Garden Bungalow with the Possums
summary: The Garden Bungalow was this year fully booked by former guests from mid January until the 12th May, 2018 .  I apologise to my lovely regulars who have been unable to book with me.  Now everything back to normal and we are open for business again.  Henry and I await your company!
space: The Garden Bungalow with the Possums is fully self contained and en suite. Separate weatherboard bungalow in my lovely garden.  Totally private, own access with parking on the quiet road; fresh flowers or fresh fruit and fresh sheets. The garden bungalow has a new queen sized bed and a bed settee and a easy chair.. There is Wifi internet access for my guests at no extra charge. There is a flat screen TV. Next to the main room is a simple but functional small kitchen which has a hob,  fridge, kettle and toaster and a microwave oven.  Basics for your arrival for a breakfast are always provided along with tea, coffee, milk and sugar and of course a fruit bowl.  I usually put a few extras in for your first few days.  There is also a table and three chairs. A slow 10 minute amble down the road takes you to the safe swimming beach on Mentone Bay where there is a small nice cafe and barbie facilites. A 5 minute walk takes you to the main line railway station at Parkdale for trains to the city
description: The Garden Bungalow was this year fully booked by former guests from mid January until the 12th May, 2018 .  I apologise to my lovely regulars who have been unable to book with me.  Now everything back to normal and we are open for business again.  Henry and I await your company! The Garden Bungalow with the Possums is fully self contained and en suite. Separate weatherboard bungalow in my lovely garden.  Totally private, own access with parking on the quiet road; fresh flowers or fresh fruit and fresh sheets. The garden bungalow has a new queen sized bed and a bed settee and a easy chair.. There is Wifi internet access for my guests at no extra charge. There is a flat screen TV. Next to the main room is a simple but functional small kitchen which has a hob,  fridge, kettle and toaster and a microwave oven.  Basics for your arrival for a breakfast are always provided along with tea, coffee, milk and sugar and of course a fruit bowl.  I usually put a few extras in for your first few day
notes: You'll love it here....the peace and the solitude and the sound of the birds.
transit: The main line railway station is a 5 minute walk from the bungalow.  The Frankston line is a direct line to the city and trains run every 20 mins usually stopping at all stations. next to the railway station is the bus stop.  both very convenient
interaction: I will be delighted to chat with my guests if they want some company and or advice on where to go and what to do....  I know the best place for fish and chips and the best beaches and the nearest healthiest bread!  I can also teach you the basics of mosaics if you ever feel like giving it a go.
house_rules: Double access gates to be closed behind you at all times to keep Henry safe.  Water is a very expensive commodity and I would appreciate you respect the cost and have power showers.  Likewise with the heating.  If you are going out for the day please turn off lights and heating and switch heating off overnight.  Check out time is 11am.  This enables me to prepare the bungalow for the 5 pm check in.
host_about:
My name is Barbara and I migrated from Hampshire, Old England in 2004 and settled here, in Parkdale, on Port Philip Bay and love it.

If you are thinking of staying here, please note, there are no city views, city is 45 minutes away on the train or drive in 20.  No bay views, but you can walk there in 10 minutes and best of all there is a map linking this listing so you can see exactly where you could be laying down your head.

If you need to be staying in Emerald,  Ivanhoe, Carnegie or Essendon then my place is not for you.  These lovely bungalows are in my beautiful garden where the birds sing in a street in Parkdale on the bay where the friendly locals are and the best coffee in town.

name: Strawbale Home In Leafy Suburb
summary: Our eco friendly home and family welcome guests to respectfully join our community life and make the most of their stay with us.  The bedroom is large, light and spacious. Tell us what you need and we will do all we can to make it happen.
space: Strawbale Home In Leafy Suburb - I am happy to share our family home for other travellers visiting Melbourne. We have a welcoming home with: reclaimed timbers, textured strawbale walls, open plan living, fire place in winter and an outside entertaining area with table tennis and bbq and couches. The guest bedroom is quiet, private and reflects the natural elements of our eco friendly home construction. Some people call it a well loved urban barn. The guest room is large, light and spacious. It has a double or queen bed with table and 2 chairs, a couch, TV (by request), wardrobe space (by request) and a shared bathroom ensuite. It has easterly views out to the garden, with great ventilation from french doors and an opposing window that open to allow a beautiful breeze into the room on warmer days. Location We are 25km from Melbourne CBD and are 15km to Mt Dandenong and 20km from the Yarra Valley. The beach, the city, the hills and the valley are all about 30mi

neighborhood_overview: Our street is community minded and cares about each others welfare and wellbeing.  Our neighbours watch out for each other and socialise quite regularly together.  We ask that you come and go from our premises with quietness and respect for the people around you.  Thank you.
access: You will be able to access the communal kitchen, the open plan lounge area and the more private lounge room where the fireplace is.  You are free to enjoy the outside spaces, and use the veggies from the garden bed in moderation.
interaction: I will be available throughout your stay to check how you are going and to meet your needs as best I can.
house_rules: Please communicate what you need so we can help you.   Please be quiet before 7am and quiet after 10pm Help keen communal spaces tidy.  Eg if you are using the fireplace or kitchen or hot tub etc Please take your shoes off in the carpet areas. Everyone aims to keep the lines of communication open so we can all understand each other better.   Your pets may be allowed to stay here but please discuss with me first.   Smoking is only allowed outside - patio entertaining area ok.
host_about: I am an adventurer of life, curious, open minded and a people person, I like to dance, cycle, do yoga and enjoy the moment that I am living.  There is almost nothing better than deepening connection and intimacy with people I have in my life, alongside being a helpful person and serving a greater purpose.  I love my work with birthing women and being a part of supporting someone to be more confident and able to achieve what they hope to achieve.

name: Life style on the Beach 豪华的海边生活
summary: Furnished 2 bedrooms situated  3.5 Km from CBD, and surrounded by parks, shops, cafes and pubs on Bay St. Trams and buses are close by.  Indoor swimming pool, gym, sauna and tennis court in this landmark ,5-start resort building complex which is under 24⁄7 security with a building manager on site. You will share with a professional female host. Prefer long term stay but flexible. 主人可以讲中文｡
space: This beautiful 2 bedrooms apartment offers a lifestyle of luxury! Located on the Port Melbourne beach your room overlooks the colourful courtyard.  Situated just 3 Km from the CBD, and surrounded by parks, shops, restaurants, cafes and pubs within 2 mins walking distance. It's the perfect place to base yourself while enjoying the best of Melbourne! Take a walk along beach, go fishing, or simply take advantage of the private ,free swimming pool, gym, sauna and tennis court located within the building complex.  It does not get any better than this, to stay in this landmark building and enjoy 5 stars resort life style!  Buses and Trams take you almost all around Melbourne, we are just 10 mins away from F1 Grand Prix Albert Park; tram trip to Australian Open venue Rod Laver Arena and MCG;   easy getaway to the Great Ocean Rd via Westgate Bridge freeway close by. Oh, did I mention how close to St Kilda and cross the bay to Williamstown? And why not take an over night  boat trip to Tasmania

summary: Nice perfect room for the smart traveler. Here in Parkville, we are close to the city and easy access to the airport. you will enjoy a 25 meter heated pool, BBQ area, and professional GYM room. Parkville is an inner suburb of Melbourne, 3 km north of Melbourne's Central Business District. You have lots of public transport close by and Melbourne University and Hospitals. Parks and beautiful areas for visitors.
space: New apartment with fast internet you will enjoy a 25 meter heated pool, BBQ area, and professional GYM room.

My baby is an angel, very calm and likes to sleep at night time, some naps at day time it’s a morning boy: time to discover this new world for him!

name: Fabulous Fitzroy, gorgeous Gertrude St.   No Ikea!
summary: Welcome to Little George, a light-filled 3 level home in vibrant Fitzroy filled with comfy furnishings and vintage touches.   With Fitzroy's almost 100 cafes, restaurants, live music venues, cocktail bars and pubs you have chosen a wonderful area to stay in.  This is an award winning Kerstin Thompson house and has been my home for 16 years.  I love living here - I hope you'll enjoy visiting, it's nice to have you!
space: Hi there, This listing is for one bedroom on the ground floor of my large 3 level home just off the wonderful Gertrude Street. (I have 2 rooms available - the other listing is 'Stunning Fitzroy own level+ensuite' listing #72576). ***Please not I only have 1 parking permit so please check it is available before booking, it usually is but it's definitely worth checking*** This is an excellent spot for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want that 'local feeling'.  Or for those lucky folk who are moving to Melbourne (nice choice!) it's a great landing pad while you look for something permanent. Located in between action-packed Brunswick and Smith Streets, this is a fantastic, diverse area full of great cafes, restaurants, wonderful local pubs, art galleries, parks, live music venues, diverse architecture and the Melbourne Museum.  The beloved #86 tram (our 'tramily') and #12 are just at the end of the road giving easy access to other parts of this wonderfully liveable city. The house
description: Welcome to Little George, a light-filled 3 level home in vibrant Fitzroy filled with comfy furnishings and vintage touches.   With Fitzroy's almost 100 cafes, restaurants, live music venues, cocktail bars and pubs you have chosen a wonderful area to stay in.  This is an award winning Kerstin Thompson house and has been my home for 16 years.  I love living here - I hope you'll enjoy visiting, it's nice to have you! Hi there, This listing is for one bedroom on the ground floor of my large 3 level home just off the wonderful Gertrude Street. (I have 2 rooms available - the other listing is 'Stunning Fitzroy own level+ensuite' listing #72576). ***Please not I only have 1 parking permit so please check it is available before booking, it usually is but it's definitely worth checking*** This is an excellent spot for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want that 'local feeling'.  Or for those lucky folk who are moving to Melbourne (nice choice!) it's a great landing pad while you look for
neighborhood_overview: One of Melbourne's smallest urban areas, Fitzroy, is a real treasure of old and new, working class and gentrification, historic preservation and modern architecture.  Right next to the city with both the Fitzroy and Carlton gardens in between, it's never boring but very relaxed.  If on the odd occasion it's noisy there are ear plugs in your bedside tables. Diversity, cafes, boutiques, galleries, pubs, parks, restaurants, cocktail bars, music, street art = good vibes.
notes: Please note the bed (an extremely comfortable queen) is against the wall on one side. It's a good idea to check Melbourne's weather report before you arrive, we really can have "all seasons in 1 day" so it's wise to bring something warm even for those summer nights.  I recommend the app 'Weatherzone'.  Help yourself to the umbrellas at the bottom of the stairs! Optus reception is not great in this room but other networks are good.
transit: There is so much to offer in Fitzroy you could spend most of your time getting around on foot.  I've left a local guide and map in your room and marked a square around the main Fitzroy streets as a start. The 86 or 112 trams go straight into the city in about 10 minutes, they run so regularly you don't even need a timetable. Hire a bike from one of the blue Melbourne Bike Share stations, the closest to us is opposite the wonderful Smith & Deli at 111 Moor Street, a 4 minute walk away. Taxi or Uber Or if you have a car my Visitor's Parking Permit might be available - first in first served!
access: Level 1 - your room, your own toilet, laundry, share bathroom, front door access Level 2 - shared dining room, lounge, kitchen & 2 large balconies (Level 3 is the other guest area of bedroom, bathroom, wee balcony & study)
interaction: This is a very independent set up.  Apart from our rooms on level 1 there is another guest room on level 3.   As we are all usually out and about enjoying Melbourne it can be rare we run into each other but I'm always contactable on my phone :)
house_rules: - Please call out 'h!' or 'bye' when you use the front door, it's nice to know who's around.  If you're uncomfortable doing this, please don't book! - Please ensure the front door is always locked and gently used - The house is just for myself, my personal guests and my Airbnb guests - It's ok to use the kitchen but not ok to bring home Cage Eggs - The records, the alcohol and the kitchen cabinets with rubber bands on them are just for my personal use - Please respect the check-in and check-out times, thank you :)
host_about:
Hi there.  I'm originally from New Zealand but moved to Melbourne 19 years ago. 
Like most people who arrive in this wonderful city we think we are going to move on, but as soon as we get here ... well, there are reasons no-one ever wants to leave!  I was lucky enough to find this great house in the best part of Fitzroy so here I still am.   I have a habit of collecting things hence all the vintage love around the house.  Over the last decade+ I've shared my home with hundreds people from all around the world.  Things I can't live without?  Friends, freedom, Fitzroy...  If you think my home sounds like your kind of pad I'd love to hear from you and know what brings you to Melbourne.

name: Light-Filled Family-Friendly House in Yarraville
summary: Relax and unwind like a local in this gorgeous Victorian home fitted out with style and flair, right in the heart of Yarraville Village.  Plenty of space for a large family (or possibly 2) to feel completely at home. Perfect for spending nights in with a full kitchen and the option for al fresco dining in the north facing courtyard. Well set up for tots with plenty of toys, books and all the baby essentials provided.
space: The house itself is a three bedroom, renovated Victorian, and as you can gauge from the pictures it is spacious, bright and more than comfortable.  The kitchen is large and complete with all modern appliances and hosts a stocked pantry of spices, oils and condiments at your disposal. You are also more than welcome to pick fresh herbs and lemons from our vege/herb garden.  The main living space has a very comfy couch and large LCD TV for those nights when you just need to relax and have some down time. There is a quality sound system too so you can have your favourite tunes wth you.
description: Relax and unwind like a local in this gorgeous Victorian home fitted out with style and flair, right in the heart of Yarraville Village.  Plenty of space for a large family (or possibly 2) to feel completely at home. Perfect for spending nights in with a full kitchen and the option for al fresco dining in the north facing courtyard. Well set up for tots with plenty of toys, books and all the baby essentials provided.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a quiet street in the hip area of Yarraville. Some of Melbourne's best cafes are close by. There is also great proximity to the city, as the train station is a one-minute walk from the door.
notes: We will provide you with 1 parking permit that will allow free parking in our street. It’s a fairly quiet street so you can almost always get a park right out the front. Without the permit, it is only free 2hr parking. But honestly, parking inspectors and very very rare in our street!! So if you have a second car, it’s highly unlikely you will get fined. But if you wish to play it safe, there is free parking in the area, just a bit further to walk!
transit: Yarraville is just 6.5kms from the city centre and can be accessed by a 15min train ride, the station is very conveniently located- 1min walk from the front door.
access: Depending on the size of your group will ascertain how many bedrooms you have access to.  Ie) A booking for 1 - 2 guests will give you access to 1 bedroom, a booking for 3-4 guests will give you access to 2 bedrooms, and a booking of 5-7 guests will give you access to all 3 bedrooms. A booking for 8-10 guests will enable you use of the sofa beds also.
interaction: I'm currently living nearby and will be just a phone call away should you need anything.
house_rules: Please be aware of access restrictions depending on the number of guests booked for: A booking of 1-2 guests = 1 bedroom / 1 queen bed A booking of 3-4 guests = 2 bedrooms / 2 queen beds A booking of 5-6 guests = 3 bedrooms / 2 queen beds and 1 double bed A booking of 7 guests = 3 bedrooms / 2 queen beds, 1 double bed, 1 single bed A booking of 8 guests = 3 bedrooms + fold out double bed A booking of 9-10 guests = 3 bedrooms + fold out double bed + single sofa bed - No stilettos inside please! We have beautiful (albeit delicate) polished floorboards and they mark very easily. - Please thoroughly wash make-up and fake tan off before using our towels / linen. If you fail to do so, and this results in linen requiring multiple washes &/or soaking, you will be charged extra for this.
host_about:
Hi, we are Georgia & James, and baby Xander,

We are a young Australian family, doing what Australians tend to do - travel!

We are now based in Melbourne after several years living in Germany and the UK. While we love this city dearly, we love to escape it in search of wilderness and adventures. 

Having used Airbnb as guests also, we are well aware of what makes a good host. We take great pride in hosting and really go out of our way to ensure you have a good time in our home. 

If you are traveling with a baby, our place is perfectly set up with all the baby paraphernalia you could possibly need! So you can travel a little lighter and know that your little one will have everything provided for. 

Looking forward to meeting you,
Georgia & James

name: Stone's Throw Studio, Belgrave
summary: Our beautiful 1 bedroom studio is suitable for 2 people with 1 double bed. It has a garden setting with a private entrance & patio. Large bathroom with clawfoot bath, separate shower and separate toilet. Located on a private street, yet walking distance to Puffing Billy, shops, bars, restaurants and train station. If you have a larger group we have a cottage as well. Please see our other listing Stone's Throw Cottage. Linen, towels and continental breakfast included. Free WIFI
space: Your one bedroom studio gives you complete  privacy. Private patio, entrance, full bathroom and separate toilet. Located in Belgrave, Dandenong Ranges. Suitable for 2 people maximum. Walking distance to Puffing Billy and Belgrave station. One hour by train or car from Melbourne's Southern Cross station.  Break free of the busy city for a few days and visit this relaxing peaceful area.  Once here, the main attraction is Puffing Billy Steam Train which chugs along several times a day through fern gullies and massive mountain ash trees. Lots of walks through the forest where in the early hours you could spot a lyrebird, echidna or wombat. We have a Trees Adventure Park nearby for those that like to brave ziplining! You will be minutes from Belgrave village and a short drive or bus trip to Sassafras and Olinda. All have unique shops and top restaurants.  This room is part of our main house and is completely private, with it's own entrance and patio.  The bathroom has a clawfoot bath, separ
description: Our beautiful 1 bedroom studio is suitable for 2 people with 1 double bed. It has a garden setting with a private entrance & patio. Large bathroom with clawfoot bath, separate shower and separate toilet. Located on a private street, yet walking distance to Puffing Billy, shops, bars, restaurants and train station. If you have a larger group we have a cottage as well. Please see our other listing Stone's Throw Cottage. Linen, towels and continental breakfast included. Free WIFI Your one bedroom studio gives you complete  privacy. Private patio, entrance, full bathroom and separate toilet. Located in Belgrave, Dandenong Ranges. Suitable for 2 people maximum. Walking distance to Puffing Billy and Belgrave station. One hour by train or car from Melbourne's Southern Cross station.  Break free of the busy city for a few days and visit this relaxing peaceful area.  Once here, the main attraction is Puffing Billy Steam Train which chugs along several times a day through fern gullies and massiv
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very lush area here in the Dandenong Ranges. Native birds are part of the setting and they'll visit your patio most days. Puffing Billy, Trees Adventure Park and  Grant's Picnic ground are walking distance ... but maybe take a 5 minute drive there. Short drives also to Burnham Piggery, Kallista, Sassafras and Olinda. Lots of amazing hikes and drives through mountain ash and fern forests.
notes: Small fridge, microwave, electric frying pan, kettle, toaster, hairdryer, toiletries and WIFI. Although we have ducted heating that will reach your room, you also have a split system A/C so you can control the temperature in winter or summer. Electric blanket included also.
transit: We are very lucky at our location. At the Belgrave train station there are many buses that will take you anywhere you'd like to go. And it's 1 hour by train into the city of Melbourne.
access: You're welcome to stroll around the garden. Enjoy any fruit in season. Our outside laundry is the only place that's shared and we have free WIFI at the propety.
interaction: Very happy to interact or to leave you in complete privacy.
house_rules: Strictly no smoking. Sorry but this room isn't suitable for children/babies or pets. The room is for 2 people only.
host_about:
I love Melbourne!! And happily run a B&B now after being in the fashion industry for years. Love meeting people from all over the world and hearing about their lives and travels. Personal travel can be difficult sometimes but we manage to get away a couple of times a year. I lived in the US for 23 yrs so I travel there a lot to visit friends and family.
Love being an AIRBNB host. Itry to keep my cottage and private suite in tip top condition with all the little necessities that I can think of to make your stay comfortable. I've lived in the area here in the Dandenong Ranges for 14 years and have a very extensive knowledge of what you should experience while here. There are lots of wonderful things to do and some fabulous restaurants too. I'll help you in any way I can. So come visit Belgrave.

name: Healesville Yarra Valley Cottage
summary: The cottage is a small self contained cabin on a picturesque property. It is simple, comfortable, clean and private. This space is perfect for people  looking for a quiet stay in a rural location with access to all the Yarra Valley offers.
space: Comfy private self contained cabin set on 3 hectare rural property. A short 5 min drive from the picturesque town of Healesville, renowned for its wildlife sanctuary, bush walks, food and wine and burgeoning arts scene. The location provides easy access to town, but in a rural and picturesque setting The cabin is one bed/sitting room with ensuite bathroom and a really nice deck looking out over a vast expanse of lawn. It has a comfy double bed with electric blanket,and there is tea and snack making facilities, mobile phone coverage, ipod dock, and CD player.We are happy to loan from our CD collection during your stay. The room isn't huge, but it is cosy and comfortable, with a  floor to ceiling window next to the bed so that you can lie in bed and look out to the mountains. Most times you will get to see mobs of kangaroos grazing on the lawn. It is situated far enough away from the house for privacy without feeling abandoned. If you're up for the walk into town it is a 30 min walk, or
description: The cottage is a small self contained cabin on a picturesque property. It is simple, comfortable, clean and private. This space is perfect for people  looking for a quiet stay in a rural location with access to all the Yarra Valley offers. Comfy private self contained cabin set on 3 hectare rural property. A short 5 min drive from the picturesque town of Healesville, renowned for its wildlife sanctuary, bush walks, food and wine and burgeoning arts scene. The location provides easy access to town, but in a rural and picturesque setting The cabin is one bed/sitting room with ensuite bathroom and a really nice deck looking out over a vast expanse of lawn. It has a comfy double bed with electric blanket,and there is tea and snack making facilities, mobile phone coverage, ipod dock, and CD player.We are happy to loan from our CD collection during your stay. The room isn't huge, but it is cosy and comfortable, with a  floor to ceiling window next to the bed so that you can lie in bed and lo
neighborhood_overview: This is a lovely leafy and quiet location. We are far enough away from town to be peaceful and secluded, while still close enough to easily access the cafes, restaurants  and tourist spots.
notes: There are kangaroos and other wildlife on the property. We would appreciate taking care, and taking off shoes inside cabin to avoid soiling carpet.
transit: There is a bus at the corner that travels into the town however service is limited. My best advice is to have a car or bike.
access: Guests are welcome to wander through the garden. The cabin has a nice deck to enjoy a glass of wine and sit in the sun.
interaction: Interaction with guests is usually kept to greeting and settling them in on arrival. We tend to come and go and allow guests to enjoy their privacy.
house_rules: This accommodation is most suitable for singles or couples. Please take off shoes inside. Wildlife lives on our property, their "evidence" can get on your shoes! Definitely no smoking inside. Parking is available on a shady concrete space under our large elm tree. Please do not park on our lovely green lawns, there is a large septic system under them which is compromised by cars or heavy equipment. Continental Breakfast provided for 2 night or more bookings.  There are no cooking facilities in the cabin. Sorry, we're presuming you've come up here for a break from all that. As a working family we aren't always available for check in before 5pm during the week,especially at short notice. However, if 24 hours notice is given we can usually make suitable arrangements. We have kept the price of Mount Lebanon Cottage low because it is a simple uncluttered space that we clean ourselves. In return we expect guests to leave the space as clean as they found it, including washing, drying dishes,
host_about:
Karen & Michael live on a 4 acre property with two grown sons, their Australian Terrier and a range of assorted wildlife, including a mob of kangaroos, marauding wombat and the occasional echidna. 
They have a strong connection to community, and love living in this part of the world. 
Karen loves to read, paint, and create things, as well as playing in a ukele band with 4 friends. Michael loves football,music, and with his background in horticulture is in charge of the garden at the property. which consists of open space as well as a vegetable garden and range of fruit trees.
They have both travelled extensively, but travelling has been on hold for a few years now. They love meeting new people

name: Handy Location, 5Beds, 3bath, 10km to CBD, Austin
summary: Newly built townhouse with quality finishing. It is fully furnished with design originals including a comfy sofa and a dining table. The main space has a TV, DVD and Wi-Fi. Stainless steel kitchen equipped with Gas Stove and Oven, dishwasher, Fridge and fully stocked with cooking utensils and crockery. Central heating keeps the space warm in winter whilst Air Conditioning throughout makes the hot summer day a pleasure. Lovely outdoor space with small garden. Enjoy home away from your home.
space: Shops, Cafes, Cinemas & Public Transport is at your doorstep. This 3 storey Townhouse come with 2 bedroom, 1 multipurpose room,  3 bathrooms, modern, comfort & convenience!  Melbourne City is only 12 K's away while Northland Shopping & Homemaker Centre, La Trobe Uni in 5-10 minutes driving distance, Austin Hospital is within walking distance!

neighborhood_overview: This place offers the best of both worlds: live where the bustling energy of Melbourne city folds into the gentle green hills of Ivanhoe. Leafy suburb just 12 km from the CBD-is renowned for beautiful homes and a treasured established community.
notes: Property has street parking available. The townhouse is a no smoking space but there is a small outdoor balcony or yard area on which you can smoke. This is three storey townhouse, elderly and young children may not be suitable.
transit: Local cafés, Aldi Supermarket, Chemist warehouse, and shops just around the corner within walking distance. Northland shopping centre is within 10 minutes driving distance. Go to La Trobe University around 20 minutes by bus. 20 minutes walk to Austin Hospital. Relax and unwind at Fairfield Park Boathouse, which is 5km away. 11km from Melbourne CBD, you can get there by car, bus or train.
access: Guests have access to the entire townhouse & yard but NOT the garage. There is free street parking at the front or the back of the house, Ivanhoe is a very safe suburb.
interaction: Available to ensure an easy check in and for any assistance required. A compendium is available in the property to ensure you have all information at your fingertips.
host_about: I have lived in Melbourne for the past 30+ years. Love travel and reading in my spare time.

summary: Beautiful Beachside Leafy Elwood! Only minutes to the Local Village bars, cafes, restaurants, supermarket, etc. This gorgeous designer apartment offers local village atmosphere and tram and buses are just a short stroll away that whisk you into Melbourne City Centre within minutes!

neighborhood_overview: Within a 5 minute walk you’ll discover the delights of the Tennyson Street Shopping Village.  Cafes, bars, restaurants, bakery, hairdresser, supermarket, wine shop and even a quaint little village church! Also close by you will find Ormond Road Village. Lots of cafes and restaurants. Try Dandelion Vietnamese Eatery. For great coffee Combi Cafe. Elwood beach is a short walk away and vibrant St Kilda is close by. Hop on a tram and enjoy a trip into the city via St Kilda Road. This passes the Botanic Gardens, The Arts Centre and fashionable Southbank river precinct, with its many bars and restaurants. This top floor views apartment is close to everything Melbourne has to offer. Definitely the place to stay.
notes: Second floor apartment without lift access. No air conditioning. Heaters/fans only. Permissible sized hot water tank that requires time to reheat water between use, especially between showers. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of Tennyson Street Village, and for travelling further afield, tram and bus stops are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: Convenient Spot in Mt Waverley
summary: The unit is right next to a small park where occasionally people exercise or just sit on the bench and enjoy the sun
space: What you see is a bright room in a 2 bedroom unit.  I have hosted overseas students for ten  years prior to hosting with airbnb and enjoy people's company. Below is what I offer : - Queen size bed with built in wardrobes - ducted heating throughout  -WiFi throughout the unit  - Mt Waverley railway station is 500 metres away and train takes  25 minutes to the city - good shopping near the train station with two medium sized supermarkets, fast food outlets and restaurants - two buses pass the door, the 733 going south to Monash Uni, north to Deakin Uni and Box Hill, 734 going west to Glen Waverley. -Washing machine with a clothes line in the back yard. The unit is well suited for those who want to attend Monash and Deakin University

house_rules: No smoking indoors Consideration for others in the unit
host_about:
I am a gentle soul who enjoys life, goes ballroom dancing, attends church,  interested in self development and finance plus learning dowsing.  Live in the leafy suburb of Mt Waverley in Melbourne, about 500 metres to the railway station, restaurants and shops

For ten years before my wife passed on we hosted overseas students who were in Australia to learn English before going to University.  Sometimes talking with the students seemed almost as good as travelling to their country

I believe its important to tell the truth and try to do it all the time.   I do not discriminate and expect guests to treat everyone in the house with courtesy and respect.

name: On the Beach. Melbourne Beach Front
summary: On the Beach is a large home in a block of 11 apartments. With beautiful features such as a bay window to the beach.  The location is perfect, tram at the back of the street block, Port Phillip Bay opposite the front door and gorgeous walks.
space: Apartment on the beach front in Melbourne. This is a block of 11 apartments, it is quiet and beautifully located.  It is located between Port Phillip Bay and Albert Park Lake, which is about half way across the western side of the Albert Park Reserve (a state park), hence the name "Middle" Park. Middle Park, along with neighbouring Albert Park contains some of the best preserved terrace house and Victorian architecture in Melbourne and is part of a strict heritage-conservation area.  This is a gorgeous apartment in Middle Park.  The apartment has one bedroom with a queen size bed.  The apartment is in a beautiful location on Beaconsfield Parade, with a wonderful beach outside the front door.  There is a tram stop around the corner which will take you to the City or the opposite way to St. Kilda.  You can walk along the Esplanade to Port Melbourne or St. Kilda.  The South Melbourne Market is only a short tram ride away and there is the local village (Armstrong Street) with good coffee s
