transit: Great tram line around the corner.  There is also light rail near by.  There is a visitor parking permit in the home for your use.
interaction: By text, email or phone.
house_rules: Smoking outside only.
host_about:
We are 2 creative artists working mostly in Melbourne.   We collect art and adore nature.  We have lived and worked in Mexico, Costa Rica, and Europe in the past few years.  Our work is in TV and film and travel regularly. We really enjoy kayaking and our holidays are almost always near water.
We love seeing different cultures and appreciating the difference in the way we all live.  Kind regards, Carmen

name: Beautiful Northcote home with heart -close to city
summary: Our 3 bedroom 1940's renovated home is light, open and full of charm. The large garden and nearby creek create an urban oasis only 20 minutes from the city by public transport (a short walk to train station and tram stop). Just minutes from CERES organic markets / farm and the restaurants and shops of High St. A safe and quiet neighbourhood. Room is perfect for solo traveller and hosts can help as much or as little as needed.
space: Our home is close to lively shopping strips, quiet creek walks and public transport. The guest bedroom room is spacious, peaceful and light with floorboards, queen bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers and large windows looking onto a native garden. You will have plenty of privacy as the room is down its own end of the house. You will have the bathroom / toilet to yourself aside from the  short time we shower there - the rest of the time we use a second toilet and sink at the other end of the house.  House is tidy and clean, pet free and non smoking.  Our large deck is the perfect place to relax in summer shade or catch some winter sun. Lovely outdoor settings to enjoy the garden. Native birds often perch on the large gum tree in the back garden. Your hosts are keen on yoga and you are welcome to loan yoga mats etc and do your yoga practice on the deck of in your room (plenty of space). Includes: Wireless internet access, fresh linen including towel & face-washer, electric kettle & tea makin

House is tidy and clean, pet free and non smoking.  Our large deck is
neighborhood_overview: We are in 15 mins walking distance of High St with an incredible choice of restaurants and boutique stores and a short tram ride from the fantastic Brunswick St (brilliant for shopping, food and all things hipster) Also 10 min walk from the wonderful CERES environment park – a demonstration site for sustainability projects and every day organic food markets, shop and cafe. Also a lovely cycle to the city if you have access to a bike.
notes: Prefer guests aged 30+ with planned work or activity itinerary. If same day booking check in will need to be after 6pm.
transit: 7-10 minute walk to tram 11 and tram 96. 12-14 minute walk to Croxton train station. Express train gets to city in 20 mins. Trams will get you to the city in 25  - 30 minutes. We can loan you a MetCard (you will need to top it up with credit at local milk bar or charging station).
access: Guest will have access to broadband internet with good download (no movie download).  Lovely garden and deck to enjoy. Welcome to use microwave in kitchen or store items in fridge but prefer kitchen use is limited (not full meal preparation). Check in 4pm onwards (this may need to be negotiable as we like to greet guests at the beginning of their stay)- check out 9.30 or 10am (depends on day)
interaction: We are quite social and would love to sit down and have a cuppa with you but if you would prefer to keep to yourself, or the main focus of your visit is work and evening rest,  that is fine too.
house_rules: Kitchen not available for meal preparation. No additional visitors unless negotiated with hosts. Grateful if you could refrain from using strong perfumes / deodorant sprays (roll on fine) / hairsprays as these scents can make me unwell.
host_about: Hosts Tania and Stephen are keen travellers and hikers. We are interested in healthy living and healthy food. We are passionate about building community and supporting environmental and social equity. We enjoy being around people who are also interested in these issues. Steve is learning the guitar (don't tell him I mentioned it :-)) and I love singing. We love Melbourne (it's full of diversity, art and entertainment) and have plenty of ideas for recommended destinations and activities.

name: Luxury Heated Room, Private Bathroom & Breakfast
summary: A lovely clean space with double bed, built in wardrobe and shelves for clothing and a private bathroom (not en suite). Crisp clean linen, towels and breakfast provided. Free WiFi and your own TV (DVD's only). Walk to a great range of shops, cafes and restaurants. Or use nearby public transport to be in the city centre in less than 30 minutes.  Hosting for over 4 years.
space: The house is on a quiet residential street but just around the corner from the main road with tram stops and nearby station and shops. There is ample free unrestricted parking in the street.  The guest accommodation consists of a double bedroom at the top of a private flight of stairs with comfortable double bed, air-conditioning/heating, huge cosy armchair, TV and DVD player (does not receive regular channels or cable TV) and plenty of storage space; plus exclusive use of the downstairs shower room (towels provided). Guests can expect a clean and comfortable night's stay. Tea and coffee making facilities are provided in the room, and there are plenty of great cafes nearby. There is a hairdryer provided with a mirror beside it. Laundry facilities and an iron and ironing board available on request. Unfortunately, only adults can be accommodated here as the room is not set up for children, however little! Breakfast is provided in the dining room which will be home made muesli, juice, fru

Free WiFi and your own TV (DVD's only). Walk to a great range of shops, cafes and restaurants. Or use nearby public transport to be in the city centre in less than 30 minutes.  Hosting for over 4 years. The house is on a quiet residential street but just around the corner from the main road with tram stops and nearby station and shops. There is ample free unrestricted parking in the street.  The guest accommodation consists of a double bedroom at the top of a private flight of stairs with comfortable double bed, air-conditioning/heating, huge cosy armchair, TV and DVD player (does not receive regular channels or cable TV) and plenty of storage space; plus exclusive use of the downstairs shower room (towels provided). Guests can expect a clean and comfortable night's stay. Tea and coffee making facilities are provided i
neighborhood_overview: Our house is perfectly located for you to enjoy and explore abundant restaurants, cute bars, and shopping. Easy walking distance (15 minutes) to a range of cafes, pubs and restaurants, the cinema and the fresh food market, open 5 days a week. The nearest wine bar and local fish and chips are just 2 minutes walk away! Auburn Village, a short stroll away down one of the finest residential strips in Melbourne, is an untouched strip dotted with boutiques and cafes for the sophisticated and friendly clientele that will keep you coming back. A perfect spot to spend a weekend brunching, riverside walking or hitting the shops.  Also in easy walking distance is Camberwell shopping centre with numerous eateries, cafes and bars and a great range of shops and boutiques, as well as several other lovely local shopping areas - Glenferrie Road in Hawthorn and Maling Road in Canterbury. Here you can find pretty much anything you may want and there is plenty to choose from in terms of restaurants and ca
notes: This is an old house and a treasured home, lovingly maintained; the layout has changed many times in it's history. The guest bedroom room is at the top of a flight of stairs which go no where else whilst the guest bathroom is at the bottom of the stairs. Great spot to stay for all the major events and attractions in Melbourne - easy transport to the F1 Grand Prix, Australian Open Tennis, Spring Racing Carnival, cricket or AFL at the MCG. Business travellers welcomed, all facilities available (WiFi, printer, scanning etc).  Note to Prospective Guests: • Hosts like us want to know who our guests are. Post an accurate profile photo of yourself (not dog or cat) and write a bit about yourself and what the purpose of your trip is. • VERIFY YOUR ID. Airbnb is going to require you to do this eventually, so do it while you aren't pressed for time. This shows you value trust in our community. (See https://www.airbnb.com/help/question/450 for more information about Verified ID.)
transit: To travel on Public Transport you will need a Myki Card, visit the PTV government website to find out details about visitor value pack passes. Myki cards can be bought from a number of outlets, including any 7/Eleven store or at the SkyBus terminal at Melbourne Airport or Southern Cross Railway Station. Walk or tram to shops, bars & restaurants in Camberwell (Burke Road), Auburn Village, Canterbury (Maling Road). Camberwell station is a gentle 15 minutes walk from the house; train travel time to the CBD (city) is 15 minutes.  Tram stops are 5 minutes walk from the house. Tram 72 which runs from Melbourne University to Camberwell, trams commence in Swanston Street near Faraday Street (University of Melbourne) and run via Swanston Street (City), St Kilda Road (Domain Interchange), Commercial Road, Malvern Road and Burke Road to terminate near Cotham Road (Kew). Coming from the city get off at tram stop number 67 and walk 5 minutes to the house. Public transport from the airport to the ho
access: Guests can come and go as they please. They have access to: Guest private bedroom (upstairs) Guest private shower room (downstairs) Dining room and Lounge room For longer staying guests we can discuss the use of the kitchen for HEAT and EAT
interaction: Our home is warm and welcoming and, as hosts, we are happy to interact with you over breakfast but also believe guests, and hosts, require a high level of privacy. Happy to communicate by email, text or telephone prior to arrival. One of us will be at home to give out keys and introduce guests to their rooms so we like to have a confirmed arrival time window
house_rules: Get in touch nearer the time you are coming to stay to make arrangements about meeting up and handing over keys.  We don't make check in/check out times but when there are guests back to back we expect people to be out of the bedroom by 10.00 am. latest, so we can clean and get ready for the next guests. You are welcome to leave your luggage safely here, by arrangement.
host_about:
I was born in the UK but moved to Melbourne with my family in the late 90's and now call this home. Since then i have been a full time mother and housewife leaving behind a successful career in marketing and design. I love to cook and am amazing housekeeper (like scary efficiency!!) so you'll be guaranteed a clean, well kept place to stay as my guest.

The most important things in my life are my family, my friends, good food, good company, good wine - what more could I need?

name: Position Perfect - Richmond
summary: This newly renovated one bedroom, one bathroom apartment is in an ideal location. It is superbly decorated and comfortable.
space: Position Perfect - Richmond apartment is a newly renovated, one bedroom apartment in the heart of Melbourne's best shopping district, Bridge Road. The apartment has a queen bed in the bedroom and a double fold out sofa bed in the living area. Up to three guests can be accommodated or two adults and two children. Children are more than welcome and there is a great playground right across the road. The apartment is equipped with a new kitchen, including oven, microwave, dishwasher and full sized fridge. It has a newly renovated bathroom with shower. Crisp, fresh, quality linen and towels are supplied for your use at no extra cost. There is a washing machine and dryer in the bathroom. A hairdryer is supplied along with a small amount of toiletries. The apartment is also equipped with an iron and ironing board. The apartment is located on level one and has no wheel chair access. There are stairs leading up to the apartment. ABOUT US At Position Perfect, we are a family owned business dedic

neighborhood_overview: Richmond is a prime shopping district with outlets and boutique stores at your door. Richmond has a multicultural vibe with various cuisines on offer, especially on Victoria street. Grocery stores are also right opposite the apartment and are open until midnight each night. Conveniently located also is a Chemist and the Epworth Hospital. Chapel Street is a short tram ride away with lots of funky bars, cafes and shopping. A tram ride into the CBD is quick and easy and the tram stops are only 40 meters from the apartment. You will also find great playgrounds and parks just outside. Plus for the sporting enthusiast, Rod Laver Arena, the MCG and Melbourne's best sporting and entertainment complexes are just up the road.
notes: PARTIES AND FUNCTIONS ARE STRICTLY PROHIBITED
transit: The apartment is close to most major attractions and the CBD. The tram is only 40metres away and a very short ride to popular attractions.
access: Included in the pricing for our apartment is fresh, clean, quality linen and towels. Parking is also included and if your vehicle is larger, we have a parking permit for you to park unrestricted in the area free of charge.  The newly renovated kitchen has all the utensils you need to have a comfortable stay. We now offer FREE WIFI! A porta cot and high chair are also available for hire. Please let us know if you have young children so we can supply you with a small basket of toys for their use. This always helps keep them entertained and our guests have appreciated this very much. Such as Tarnie who said "The apartment was absolutely spotless, really impressive. It was in the most handy spot. Like a little haven in the middle of a busy area. Danielle was so lovely and helpful and organised the apartment to be ready a little earlier for me. The complimentary bottle of red was highly appreciated, and the thoughtfully provided toys were the highlight for my children. Everything was way be
interaction: You may see us floating around the complex...or you may not! We make access to the apartment easy so meeting up and arranging times is not necessary. If you'd like us to come for a chat give us a shout out!

summary: Our Carlton Paris style apartment is a stylish one bedroom one bathroom apartment located just off Lygon Street, Carlton.
space: Position Perfect Carlton- Paris Style apartment is a one bedroom apartment conveniently located just off beautiful Lygon Street, or ‘Little Italy’. This apartment is on the second floor with stairs leading up to the apartment. There is no wheel chair access.  The apartment has a queen bed in the bedroom and a double fold out sofa bed in the living area. Up to three adults can be accommodated, or two adults and two children.  The apartment is equipped with a brand new kitchen, including oven, microwave, dishwasher and full sized fridge. It has a fully renovated bathroom with shower, off the bedroom. Crisp, fresh, quality linen and towels are supplied for your use at no extra cost. We offer our guests a parking permit to use during your stay. This allows you to park unrestricted in the permit zone 4C spaces. There are several permit parking spaces directly outside the apartment block. neighborhood_overview: Carlton is a buzzing area, full of culture, cuisine and class. Step around the corner of the apartment and be dazzled by the array of fine eateries, cafes, delicious pastries and gorgeous boutiques. Take a walk along the Lygon street strip into the beautiful gardens or laze about in the Piazza. Carlton is close to the CBD, Royal Melbourne Hospital, Royal Dental Hospital, Universities and some of Melbourne's most famous attractions. From the apartments you can catch the tram into the CBD or even into Melbourne’s northern suburbs. In this complex we have two, one bedroom apartments available. Please view Position Perfect Carlton Courtyard apartment to view the other apartment.
notes: PARTIES AND FUNCTIONS STRICTLY PROHIBITED
transit: PLACES TO WALK TO: .1min walk to Lygon st .8min walk to 3D Imax and Exhibition Buildings/Museum .2min walk to Melbourne University .5min walk to RMIT From the apartment you can catch the tram into the CBD or even into Melbourne’s northern suburbs. Or you could take advantage of the FREE shuttle bus service with the stop only 30metres from the apartment. .5min walk to Royal Melbourne Hospital & Dental .10min walk to Melbourne CBD .20min Walk to Victoria Market .10min walk to Brunswick st .15min walk to Smith st
access: Included in the price for our apartments is fresh, clean, quality linen and towels. Our Carlton Paris style apartment has a parking permit for you to park in residential zones. We now offer FREE WIFI The kitchen has all the utensils you need to have a comfortable stay. A porta cot and high chair are also available for hire. There is an all in one washing machine/dryer in the kitchen.  The bathroom has a hairdryer and a small amount of toiletries. There is also an iron and an ironing board. Please let us know if you have young children so we can provide them with a basket of toys for their stay. Enjoy our special touches and be wowed, as was Kerry “Sometimes in life you get lucky - and this is one of those times. Position could not be bettered. So well equipped, clean and lovely bedding too. Very very very happy! :-)”

summary: 300 metres from Malvern station, 15 minutes to CBD. On several tram lines (no. (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and 6) that service the other inner and outer middle suburbs.  On popular shopping/cafe strip and large park. Walk to Monash Caulfield or one stop.
space: Classic colonial home on Caulfield Park hill. Between park, train station, trams and popular Glenferrie shopping and resteraunt strip. 15 minutes from city centre.  There are two rooms available. This one is a medium/large. A larger one with a separate study may also be available (see Amazing Malvern listing). The house is a classic renovated late Edwardian (Tudor revival) style two story home that will remind you of a villa in Tuscany of the south of France or visiting Gran. at the family farm in the country yet it is only minutes from the CBD.  As well as your private bedroom, guests can enjoy two lounge areas with antique furniture and open fireplaces. A very cosy atmosphere is maintained with central heating (and cooling in summer) and several seperate recreational areas for you to relax, read or watch tv etc. Kitchen facilities are always available and breakfast ingredients provided. There is a deck at the back with BBQ facilities and a partially enclosed all weather rear terrace.

name: Large room in quiet Victorian home
summary: Located in a large fully furnished home with beautiful, private garden.  Situated in a quiet cul de sac between Fitzroy Street St Kilda and Chapel Street Windsor, it's walking distance to the best of what St Kilda and Windsor / Prahran have to offer.
space: Welcome to St Kilda! This home has it all and is located in a very quiet small street yet right in the middle of St Kilda! The home is nicely furnished and has two large Victorian sized bedrooms. Both rooms consists of a very comfortable queen / double bed and you have everything you need for a nice and relaxing stay in Melbourne. Location St Kilda is just a 10 minute walk to Albert Park Lake, Chapel Street shopping, Fitzroy Street restaurants, Acland Street cafes & bars or St Kilda Beach. It is also very close to Windsor Railway Station which is three stops for the CBD. Numerous tram lines run close by. About St Kilda St Kilda is Melbourne's favourite beachside suburb. Its the perfect place to wander, cycle or skate under the palms on the foreshore. Take a stroll through the Esplanade Arts and Craft Market and enjoy the great selection of cafes and restaurants. If you're lucky, you may even get see little penguins at the St Kilda Breakwater . I look forwa

name: Warm and inviting cottage in the North East
summary: Warm and inviting inter-war (between the world wars) cottage in Melbourne's green wedge.  Minutes from transport to the city, airport, LaTrobe Uni Bundoora, RMIT Bundoora.  Only a picturesque hour drive to the Yarra Valley.  Easy driving to Kinglake National Park.   Great area which is more like a small village swallowed up by the city. With an active cafe and restaurant culture. Plenty of choice. Lots of local wildlife, including possums, lorikeets and rosellas.

I'm happy to interact with my guests and give them guidance on what to do and where to go in the area. Or I can give you space if you wish. Montmorency is like a small country village that was surrounded by the city. It's situated on a high point above
neighborhood_overview: Montmorency is like a small country village that was surrounded by the city. It's situated on a high point above Melbourne, there are lots of nature reserves and old trees with lots of birdlife and possums running around at night. Nearby Were Street has great cafe and breakfast choices, restaurants, shops and a supermarket.  There are two major shopping centres within an easy drive.
notes: My cats (Milamber and Delilah) and dog (Happy) are very social and friendly. They have ability to come in and out of the house as it suits them.
transit: The house is well situated with a quick walk to the train station (two blocks) through a little access walkway and easy access to buses going to nearby shopping hubs, the airport and other key locations.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is safe and a great place for cafés, shopping or the parks and gardens across the road including the Melbourne Cricket ground. Everyone who stays loves it.
notes: Broadband internet 100gb per month plus local calls. Undercover secured entry and parking.
transit: There is a tram stop to the CBD 50m away or easy access to north south or east of Melbourne, via buses and Richmond station is 400m away.
interaction: I usually contact the arriving guest within 24 hours to make sure everything is ok. I am available to answer any questions at any time. I live in France so I apologise for any delay due to time difference.
house_rules: Please note that any cooking odours particularly middle eastern cooking effecting the soft furnishings on departure or excessive cleaning fees will incur additional cleaning fees as assessed by my professional cleaning company.
host_about:
I am an Australian living in rural Normandy France which I love. I came here 10 years ago to following my dream to live in France. My French cottage is a completely renovated 19th century old stone house in the Baie of Mont St Michel.
I  also have my Melbourne apartment in the CBD opposite the MCG which I have available for people coming to stay a short time in Melbourne or relocating for work. I love and enjoy both locations for the history and above all the people and the different lifestyles. I hope you enjoy your stay at one of my properties.
My life's motto?....I have many but most of all I follow this one:
Begin with what you are in no doubt of ... what makes you happy. Take the time to feel secure in your choices and the rest will follow.
A bientot
marilyn

name: Flinders Lane Architect Loft Style Apartment
summary: Welcome to the award winning architecturally designed apartment in a historic heritage building located on Melbourne's iconic Flinders Lane.
space: The spacious, creative and light filled apartment has two small bedrooms, one bathroom with bath and modern kitchen. It features lots of tactile ply joinery with lots of plant life. The apartment will suit couples, singles and also small families.  The apartment has been featured in many books and magazines including Kinfolk Home, The Design Files, The Saturday Papers, Inside Out and Belle to name a few. It features very high ceilings, huge northerly facing arched windows on all sides of the apartment and a decent sized balcony with views over the Arts Centre with a small BBQ. It is filled with natural light and streaming sunshine.  Every detail has been considered - miele appliances, super fast WIFI, very comfy queen bed with lovely linen, concealed dishwasher and fridge, deep bath, a great selection of design and architecture books, Tivoli stereo, Flat screen TV, brilliant heating and carefully chosen objects and furniture from around the world. This is the perfect base to return to

neighborhood_overview: Melbourne CBD is a great place to live. There is no need for a car. Beautiful gardens, galleries and the best restaurants in Melbourne are all in easy walking distance.
notes: Sensitive sleepers take note: Due to the central location there is city/street noise during the day and night.
transit: Flinders Street Station is a few minutes walk away. There are also a number of tram stops within walking distance. You are well connected to all of Melbourne from this apartment.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: I'll be available to answer questions during your stay.
house_rules: Please treat the home as you would your own.  Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  No parties If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a $80 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an $150 fee will apply.
host_about: I work as a project director in the field of design and cultural programming.  Enjoy Melbourne!

name: Bohemian Bungalow in Brunswick
summary: A harmonious and cosy place, over looking a park in a dead end street. Within walking distance to all the bohemian cultural offerings of Brunswick.
space: Lovely relaxed bungalow in bohemian Brunswick, Melbourne, Victoria.  It is a dream location. A quiet dead end street with a park out the front and close to everything you could possibly need or want including trams, trains, buses and taxis. It is centrally located and walking distance to everything.  This price includes wifi, washing machine, guitars, AC in the summer, a good heater in the winter and under cover car parking. We do not have a television beware! We are Joe, Julie and Raven, we are a  musical family, passionate human beings with a high regard for other humans and nature. We love a laugh and good music, art, food, gardening, people etc. You will love staying here in this cosy, tranquil and joyous abode.

Shoes are totally safe on the patio but if you have a pair of Pradas you may want to bring them inside with you :)

host_about: I am easy going and friendly who likes travelling, going to the cinema,  seeing live music, dancing, going to the beach, shopping, keeping fit and hanging out with friends, family and my cat. name: Clarelee - Belgrave Accommodation
summary: Clarelee' 5-BR guesthouse $140/room OR $500/whole house. Clarelee is close to Puffing Billy. NOTE: Rooms are BOOKED INDIVIDUALLY. Base rate is for self-catering. $140/room/night  or $500 (whole house)/night plus Aibnb fee. All bedrooms have ensuite. Light breakfast option is an additional $10/room/night
space: $140/room OR $500/whole house. Clarelee - Belgrave Boutique Accommodation - is a modern 5-bedroom guesthouse in a bushland setting. ROOMS ARE BOOKED INDIVIDUALLY: $140/room/night OR $500/night (whole house). The basic rate is self-catering, with an additional $10/room/night for a light tea, coffee, toast and museli breakfast. Clarelee is ideal for groups, wedding parties and families.  Close to some of the best features of the Dandenongs including Puffing Billy and Sherbrooke Forest, you can walk to Belgrave station, Cameo Cinema, restaurants and clubs, or relax and enjoy spectacular city lights views from the balconies.  A short drive to local tourist destinations and wedding venues in nearby townships such as Sassafras and Olinda, Clarelee uniquely blends modern lifestyle facilities with a range of service options.

host_about:
Puffing Billy accommodation in Belgrave is easy –  try Clarelee - Belgrave Boutique Accommodation. 
 
Our modern 5-bedroom guesthouse in a bushland setting  provides bed and breakfast or self-catering options.

Clarelee is ideal for groups, wedding parties and families. 

Close to some of the best features of the Dandenongs and Sherbrooke Forest, you can walk to Belgrave station, Cameo Cinema, Ruby’s Lounge, restaurants and clubs, or relax and enjoy spectacular city-light views or observe native birdlife from the balconies. 

A short drive to local tourist destinations and wedding venues in nearby townships such as Sassafras and Olinda, Clarelee uniquely blends modern lifestyle facilities with a range of service options.

Room rates start at $120 (midweek, self-catering).

Weekend Self-catering Rates
Spa Suite QB $170, North, South and Standard Suites QB $140, Middle Suite DB plus Futon $140 

Light Breakfast Rate
Additional $10/room/night

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is fully self contained and separate from our house.  Secure and lockable. VERY QUIET, PEACEFUL and SAFE SUBURBAN AREA.  with good neighbours all around. ONLY 12 klms from Melb city.    Our property has a small wedding chapel at the front, that is the first thing you will see when you arrive here. I am a govt authorised Marriage Celebrant. Police checked and credentials for both my wife and I. Melb university & colleges have checked and approved our accommodation as excellent for teachers and students.  Thai royal palace staff stay here regularly. Please use electricity sensibly and turn off appliances when not used.  Thank you Mal & Nok
notes: NO SMOKING ANYWHERE INSIDE. BOOK IN: 10 am  -  8pm   BOOK OUT:  1BEFORE 12 noon NO FOOD & NO COOKING IN THE BEDROOMS. If you move any furniture, please put it back before you leave. Please observe the Electricity fair use policy,  Please use electricity sensibly and turn off appliances when not being used.  PETS: Sorry no pets.  TIP: Have a look on internet to see where Hadfield is. Electricity fair use policy applies.  Please use electricity sensibly and turn off appliances when not used.
transit: 12 klms from Melb city & 12 klms from Melb airport (Tullamarine) Taxi from airport about $29 (day rate).  Public transport from airport is not recommended From where we are there is plenty of convenient public transport. Bus, train & tram all connect to the city and all suburbs. TIP: Have a look on internet to see where we actually are.
access: Ground floor, no stairs. Full kitchen. Out door dining in our very nice gardens, safe garden for children to play in. Park across the road with childrens' play section with swings etc.  Parental supervision required.
interaction: We will you be here to assist you during your stay. We interact with our guests, as much as they want.  Total privacy nice & quiet......or Lets have a BBQ together, share meals, have a drink ...  But NO SMOKING ! Electricity fair use policy applies.  Please use electricity sensibly and turn off appliances when not used.
house_rules: NO SMOKING ANYWHERE INSIDE. Please look after our apartment and keep it neat, clean & tidy. NO FOOD & NO COOKING IN THE BEDROOM. Please clean the BBQ after each use. If you move any furniture, please put it back before you leave.  INTERNET:   Plenty of fast cable and wi-fi internet for personal use. For business or commercial use excess fee may apply. No loud excessive noise after 10pm. Simply: No pets, no smoking and keep the apartment neat & tidy.
host_about:
Friendly and outgoing. 
Member of Rotary International Pascoe Vale Vic Australia
Govt. Authorised Marriage Celebrant. 
We have conducted more than 300 weddings and most of them have been here in our own Chapel.
Private Investigator for over 30 years.
My wife's name is Nok, she is Thai & an excellent wife of many years, she is a fully qualified Thai journalist. Nok helps students here at home, that are learning English at Melb colleges and Thai Royal Place staff that are regular  guests here.
We both provide legal services and advice to Melb Courts & solicitors. 
Nok makes sure the accommodation here is very clean, neat & tidy, she is also an excellent gourmet cook, perhaps we can all share a meal or two during your stay here with us.

name: Parkland apartment on edge of CBD
summary: Light filled and quirky in a quiet parkland neighbourhood. The apartment is on two levels with a mezzanine floor and high windows on both upper level rooms. The two bathrooms are connected by a shared toilet.  The living room has a large north facing window looking onto the courtyard garden
space: This stylish "A" framed contemporary apartment of the late 70's is one of 16 apartments (8 on either side of a central driveway) comprising two levels and a courtyard garden. The upstairs level has two bedrooms (one is a mezzanine open to the living room) and two bathrooms sharing one central toilet. The main bedroom has a comfortable king sized bed. The second mezzanine bedroom has a fold out single couch/bed.   Downstairs is an open plan kitchen/dining/sitting room with floor to ceiling double glazed, north facing windows opening onto an attractive Japanese styled, courtyard garden. The kitchen has AEG appliances and the second bathroom has a washing machine and dryer. Off street parking available for one car. Parkville is an historic inner Melbourne suburb adjoining the central business district north of the city and home to the gracious campus of The University of Melbourne and the Melbourne Cemetery. As it's name implies this suburb abounds in beautiful open parklands. Apartment "

name: Gorgeous Peace btw City and Airport
space: Two minutes to bus, then tram or train to city, 12-15 minutes drive to the airport. Discover and fall in love with Melbourne and then re-energize in your own  light-filled double room, with 3 ceiling to floor windows overlooking greenery. Rest on the double wool-cloud futon bed and enjoy the walk-in wardrobe with plenty of shelving, full length mirror, bedside lamp, woolen doona and fresh towels in a bright, clean, new apartment.  There is a shared, modern bathroom with instant full pressure hot water in the shower and bath.  Located 10 kms directly north of the CBD and 15 minutes drive to the airport (taxi is approximately $30) this accommodation provides an excellent base for a quick getaway to the airport or late arrival combined with direct access via public transport to the city.  It is two minutes walk to bus stop for transport to city. Train approx. 21 minutes journey to city  (Flagstaff Station), and 13 mins to the World Class Melbourne Zoo .  Free, safe parking on street.  In

house_rules: Welcome to my place. I wish to host people who are respectful of my apartment and take care of its furnishings. You are welcome to share the loungeroom to relax and watch television. Pls vacate this common area after 10 pm and complete showering by this time. You may keep food in the refrigerator and use the microwave, toaster, crockery and cutlery. Laundry service (wash, dry and fold) available for small fee. Smoking is allowed outside. If arriving back late, please come in quietly.  Thank you and enjoy your stay.
host_about: I enjoy travelling and meeting new people. I work in education and language research and testing. I am looking forward to meeting you and will do my best to provide you with information you need to see Melbourne.

name: Beautifully Appointed Apt - Central
summary: Our apartment is loved by travellers for its beautifully comfortable bed, with crisp cotton bed linen, its great bathroom with huge walk in shower that people love, and free wifi.  A quick walk to the Queen Vic Markets to stock up on provisions!
space: The Chetwynd Apartment is for those seeking the convenience of an inner city location with the comfort of a newly renovated, fully equipped boutique apartment that is truly a home away from home.  Providing 1 bedroom with a queen bed and a sofa bed in the living room it is ideal for 1-3 persons.  There is a fully equipped separate and modern kitchen with stovetop, oven, dishwasher, microwave, and fridge.  Wireless internet connection is free and there is a digital flat scene TV and sound system.   The apartment is seconds away from a tram which can whisk you into Central melbourne in 5 minutes or you can take a leisurely stroll and be there in 15 minutes.  We are 10 minutes walk to both North Melbourne Station and Melbourne Central station, 7 minutes walk from Flagstaff station and about 15 minutes walk from Southern Cross Station (the main station for intercity trains and also the arrival/departure point for the Melbourne Airport SkyBus). neighborhood_overview: The apartment is seconds away from a tram which can whisk you into Central melbourne in 5 minutes or you can take a leisurely stroll and be there in 15 minutes.  We are 10 minutes walk to both North Melbourne Station and Melbourne Central station, 7 minutes walk from Flagstaff station and about 15 minutes walk from Southern Cross Station (the main station for intercity trains and also the arrival/departure point for the Melbourne Airport SkyBus). North Melbourne is rapidly becoming one of inner Melbourne's most sought after suburbs and is full of fantastic cafes and restaurants.  It is also home to some wonderful little bars. We are 400 meters away from the renowned Queen Victoria Markets, truly one of the worlds great food markets.
transit: Tram stop almost at the door, and walking distance to Melbourne Central (12minutes) Flagstaff (8 minutes) and North Melbourne (15 minutes) railway stations.

name: Modern apartment with amazing views
summary: Spacious apartment, 4kms to the CBD. Quiet street with golf course. One block from Princes Park with its running track. Enjoy your own sunny room and private bathroom, access to large living area, kitchen & laundry. Short walk to tram and train.
space: Located in a quiet, central part of inner Melbourne, this sun-filled apartment is the perfect place to explore everything the city has to offer. Set in a contemporary building, I would love to share this large apartment with you. Located in a quiet area, it is a short tram ride to the central city district. It is surrounded by parklands (Royal Park and Princes Park). The apartment features floor to ceiling windows, providing sensational views of Melbourne. Bedroom  Your room has floor-to-ceiling windows. It is a cheery and bright room. It has its own private balcony.  It comes with a large bathroom for your exclusive use. Wardrobe space is available.  Included in the price are: Use of the house facilities (kitchen, laundry) Fresh linen and towels. Secure underground car park  Air-conditioning or heating  A simple breakfast  High speed wi-fi. TV, radio and a piano, for those of you musically inclined! Make yourself at home in either of the two common living areas and the kitchen.  Use t

neighborhood_overview: Parkville is a quiet and tranquil oasis, 4 kms from the Melbourne Central Business District CBD). Renowned for its world class university and hospitals, what people also discover are its beautiful parklands, its fantastic collection of Victorian homes, its fantastic access to public transport (train and tram) which can take you in and out of the city quickly, and its proximity to other bustling areas such as Brunswick, the new cool and funky area of inner Melbourne., and Carlton, the italian centre with its pizzerias, stylish clothes stores, cinema and bookstores.
notes: This is a quiet building in a tranquil parkland setting. Its difficult to imagine you are in a big city!
transit: The apartment is perfectly located for you to enjoy and explore the abundant restaurants, bars, pubs, art galleries, bookshops, theatre, musical venues and shopping. For those of you who enjoy walking,  the CBD, Zoo, Victoria Market and Carlton can be reached on foot, otherwise the Route 19 tram is just around the corner. This Route runs along Elizabeth Street into the city or can take you into the heart of Brunswick.  Trams are frequent and our stop is number 17.  The Upfield train line is also close by (Royal Park station). This takes you directly to Southern Cross station to link to the airport skybus or to attractions such as Puffing Billy (Belgrave line link).  Making your way around Melbourne arent difficult when you stay here.
access: I fit in with guests' needs as best I can.  Security The building is fully secure. Access is by swiper. Swiper replacement, if lost, is $50.
interaction: I can help out as much or as little as you need.
house_rules: No Smoking.  No additional guests unless cleared beforehand. Guests need to be respectful of others - not throwing objects from the balconies or making excessive noise so as to cause a nuisance.
host_about:
Professional. Enjoy theatre, music, reading, cycling, walking AND travelling - anywhere off the beaten track. Favourite travel destinations are Norway and Spain.
I travel light and really enjoy staying with people, rather than impersonal hotels. I want to experience the day-to-day life of where I go, learn tips from the locals on what to do, where to go ... and generally, blend in and live like a local. 
As a host, I am friendly, open and very much enjoy getting to know people, who they are, what they do and sharing life's experiences. 
Fluent in italian, happy to provide italian conversation classes for those of you interested in brushing up on your language skills!!!!

name: Treehouse apartment in Fitzroy
summary: Spacious, light filled one bedroom apartment in the heart of Fitzroy. The apartment is in a prime location with amazing cafes, restaurants, shops and transport options on your doorstep. Yet it's also very peaceful and quiet and surrounded by trees.
space: Ideal for a single person or couple, the apartment is very light, clean and spacious with a lovely atmosphere.  It is often compared to a tree-house as it is surrounded by greenery, flowers and birds.  As you near the entrance stairs you are surrounded by bamboo, the front door is overlooked by a huge fig tree (bare in winter and full in summer) and the balcony and living room are shaded by an amazing and huge lemon scented gum tree whose smell wafts inside with the breeze. Built in the 1950’s the space is clean, and the design classic. It has thick parquetry floorboards and large windows.  The furnishings are stylish and uncluttered.  The space is quiet and private and on entering you will notice that it has a great energy about it.  In the bedroom, there is a very comfortable, high quality queen size bed. Fresh towels and bed linen are provided. There is hanging space in the bedroom closet and ample storage for bags.  There is a single mattress available for a third person if necessa
description: Spacious, light filled one bedroom apartment in the heart of Fitzroy. The apartment is in a prime location with amazing cafes, restaurants, shops and transport options on your doorstep. Yet it's also very peaceful and quiet and surrounded by trees. Ideal for a single person or couple, the apartment is very light, clean and spacious with a lovely atmosphere.  It is often compared to a tree-house as it is surrounded by greenery, flowers and birds.  As you near the entrance stairs you are surrounded by bamboo, the front door is overlooked by a huge fig tree (bare in winter and full in summer) and the balcony and living room are shaded by an amazing and huge lemon scented gum tree whose smell wafts inside with the breeze. Built in the 1950’s the space is clean, and the design classic. It has thick parquetry floorboards and large windows.  The furnishings are stylish and uncluttered.  The space is quiet and private and on entering you will notice that it has a great energy about it.  In the
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the heart of Fitzroy - one of the most iconic, vibrant, hip and central neighbourhoods in Melbourne. Fitzroy is known for the best shops, restaurants, bars, galleries, music, graffiti, street life and people watching.  Truthfully, there is too much going on to begin to list it all! Walk to Brunswick St, Gertrude St, Smith St, Lygon St and the Melbourne CBD.  The apartment is located opposite Carlton Gardens, Exhibition Buildings and the Melbourne Museum. It is close to Melbourne University, RMIT and St Vincent’s Hospital.  All important services are within short walking distance.  There are two supermarkets, many cafes, banks, pharmacies, bakeries, restaurants, parks, a cinema, music venues and more.
notes: If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Let me know if you'd like an early check in or late check out as it may be possible.
transit: Walk to Brunswick St, Gertrude St, Smith St, Lygon St and the Melbourne CBD  (less than 1km or 10-15 mins). I have guests tell me that they didn't end up taking any transport as there is so much to explore on foot. The trams 86, 96 and 112 are all within a five minute walk. Parliament Train Station is a ten minute walk (or 3 minute tram ride) and can take you anywhere in Melbourne.  There are many bike paths in the area. If you feel like hiring a bike and discovering Melbourne as a local, The Humble Vintage is just around the corner.  Sports enthusiasts can easily access the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), Melbourne Tennis Centre and Etihad Stadium on public transport.
access: The apartment has wireless Internet access.  There are all sorts of books and brochures about things to do in Melbourne.  The shared laundry has a washing machine and dryer.  There is an off street parking space for one car.  Once the reservation is confirmed I’ll send through the check in details.  Check in is at 3pm and check out at 11am.  Late arrivals are fine as I can leave the keys waiting for you in a lock box.  If you need to drop your bags off earlier, just let me know when you make the reservation as it is often possible to arrange this.
interaction: The apartment is your own quiet and private retreat right in the heart of Melbourne.  I am overseas at the moment so I won’t be there to meet and greet you when you arrive.  I have a Property Manager who is available if there is an emergency so I will provide her details once the reservation is booked.  Of course I am also available on email or text message if you have questions at any time. On arrival you will also find comprehensive information about the apartment and things to do in the area.
house_rules: No smoking or pets.  Building is relatively quiet so please respect the neighbours and keep the noise down at night. The laundry is shared between four apartments. Access is generally easy but if it's busy there is a laundrette at the end of the street. About a two minute walk.
host_about: Lover of art, dance, music, love, laughter, water and the magic and mystery of life.  I listed my much-loved apartment on airbnb in November 2011 as I took off on a three month dancing trip to the San Francisco Bay Area.  It’s now seven years of sharing my beautiful home with people from all over the world.  I love being part of the airbnb community.  It’s a very sweet, connecting experience.  Happy travels!

name: Albert Park: Between St Kilda & CBD - Perfect spot
summary: King Size bed, selection of pillows, free flowing hot shower, a breakfast to set you up for a great day in Melbourne & wifi  A generous continental breakfast provided including GF options. Melbourne's best kept secret - Albert Park home to Bars, cafes & connected by 3 tram routes to St Kilda, Fitzroy & CBD. Quiet tree lined street just 3 minutes walk to a wide selection of cafes, bars, restaurants.  MSAC, Lake & Beach within 7 mins walk.
space: Guests have a king size bed, fabulous linen and a private bathroom with a free flowing hot shower over bath. Big fluffy towels provided. A fabulous self serve breakfast featuring a range of fresh fruit, yoghurts and cereals.    Albert Park, an upmarket and safe area of Melbourne, 2 km closer to the CBD than St Kilda and just 2 km from St Kilda.  Albert Park 600 metres from the Bay and 3 kms from Melbourne CBD. Guests also have use of the dining room and lounge room.    Much of what Melbourne offers is easily accessed by foot or tram from Albert Park!   3 tram routes  provide direct links (no transfers needed)  to SkyBus Southern Cross station, St Kida, the CBD, South Melbourne Market, Fed Square, RMIT & Melbourne Uni, Fitzroy, Richmond, Lygon St (Little Italy), the Exhibition and Convention Centre and the Casino. Nearby bike share also available. Recently published books that highlight aspects of Melbourne for everyone are available to peruse.  Middle Park Village (3 restaurants, 1 win
description: King Size bed, selection of pillows, free flowing hot shower, a breakfast to set you up for a great day in Melbourne & wifi  A generous continental breakfast provided including GF options. Melbourne's best kept secret - Albert Park home to Bars, cafes & connected by 3 tram routes to St Kilda, Fitzroy & CBD. Quiet tree lined street just 3 minutes walk to a wide selection of cafes, bars, restaurants.  MSAC, Lake & Beach within 7 mins walk. Guests have a king size bed, fabulous linen and a private bathroom with a free flowing hot shower over bath. Big fluffy towels provided. A fabulous self serve breakfast featuring a range of fresh fruit, yoghurts and cereals.    Albert Park, an upmarket and safe area of Melbourne, 2 km closer to the CBD than St Kilda and just 2 km from St Kilda.  Albert Park 600 metres from the Bay and 3 kms from Melbourne CBD. Guests also have use of the dining room and lounge room.    Much of what Melbourne offers is easily accessed by foot or tram from Albert Park!
neighborhood_overview: A quiet street in leafy Albert Park midway between Melbourne CBD and St Kilda.   A 300 metre walk from the start of a strip of more than 20 restaurants and pubs.  The room is safe, convenient and spacious and air conditioned.  The house is just 3 km from the centre of the city yet  has no through traffic.  All located within 600m: - Beach - Albert Park shops - Cafes, including the Albert Park Deli, Combi Espresso coffee & Hausfrau - Restaurants, including the famed Misuzu's & Lina's Bistro a Vin - Bars, including the Albert Park Hotel & Santiago Tapas - Albert Park grand prix circuit - Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre MSAC - 5 minutes on the 12  tram to St Kilda Nearby facilities for sporting activities and the arts include: - Fabulous running tracks at the Tan, along the beach and also around Albert Part and the new Athletics Centre - Public Hire Tennis Courts (en tous cas) available at Fawkner Park. and (hard  court) at the Rod Laver Arena - Public Golf Courses (Albert Park 1.5km)
notes: Early check-in and late check out may be possible - please ask in plenty of time. Leaving bags early (after 0800) is ok. Leaving bags late (until 2200 on your check out day) is ok and a late shower may be possible.
transit: The beach, Albert Park Golf Course and South Melbourne market are within 10 minutes walk.  There are three different tram routes within 500 metres [Routes #1, #12 and #96] - all go to the city when north bound.  The #12 and #96 go to St Kilda when southbound. The #1 goes to South Melbourne beach when south bound. There is also a bus two streets away that travels from Port Melbourne to Elsternwick rail station.
access: Getting from the airport:  Public transport consists of the Skybus from the airport (T1, T2 and T3) to the city (or less regularly to St Kilda from T4) and then a tram (but you must buy a MYKI card $5 and then load the card) before you board the tram. Taxis cost between $65 and $80 plus tolls.   Ask for details of a limo driver who will meet you at customs, carry your luggage and bring you to the door for a fixed around $85 to $90.   A number of guests have used him and then booked him when they leave too.
interaction: Interaction is at the guests' discretion.   Most catching up occurs on checking in and just before dinner time.   As I mostly work from home I am never far away.  I have prepared some walks that will introduce you to Melbourne and its little secrets - to take you to Melbourne as Melburnians use and see Melbourne. I have also prepared a driving guide for those who wish to visit the Great Ocean Road and Otways (my favourite cycling destination) - what we highlight the sights the paid tours miss.   You can rent a car and all major car rental companies (Avis, Hertz, Thrifty and Budget) are within 1500 metres.   For most enjoyment of the Great Ocean Road plan a 2-3 day trip and if you take 3 days you can return clockwise via the fabulous Grampians instead of retracing your steps. Usually my day starts much earlier than the guests as I am out on the bike from as early as 0530 and guests usually end their day much later than mine
house_rules: Apply common courtesy and common sense.   No food or drink in the bedroom and clean up after yourself - promptly.    Common courtesy and common sense includes the following: •The number 1 courtesy is clean up the mess you make and never ever leave food scraps around.  •Always place the key safe key back in the safe immediately after use to ensure it is there if you lock yourself out.  •Lock up when you leave. •Turn off the heaters and or a/c when you leave.  •Do not take food or drink to the bedroom (water excepted). •Please ask before inviting guests back. •
host_about:
Relaxed but keen on staying fit and healthy. Work in the legal field. Love good food.  Enjoy exploring other places. 

Enjoy cycling. Regularly make the one hour drive to cycle along the Great Ocean Road.  Ridden in many Euro countries, the USA and Japan in the last couple of years.

access: The apartment is in the centre of the city on the edge of the central business district and Fitzroy Gardens. Despite its proximity to the city it is located in a beautiful courtyard garden setting and every one comments on the beauty and quiet.

notes: We want people to love our house as much as us and your stay to be as comfortable and pleasant as possible,  so happy to accommodate as much as needed. host_about:

We are putting our house up for rent so that we can go and do some more travelling and this time with the kids.  You absolutely wont be disappointed with our house. 
It's in a great location and is very family and child friendly.

Enjoy restaurants, cafes, shopping, grocery stores, bakeries beach, public transport, etc., all just steps away. FREE WiFi FREE on-site secure off street parking bay First floor 1 bedroom apartment Separate spacious living room with 2.5 seater sofa, armchair & footstool Flatscreen 32" LCD TV Sound system with iPod dock & DVD/CD player Selection of books, magazines, DVDs, CDs Separate kitchen with dining area Complimentary kitchen, bathroom & laundry starter provisions Bedroom with queen bed, hotel quality linens, bedside tables, reading lamps, double mirrored wardrobe Central bathroom with shower over bath & plush bath towels Separate Euro laundry with washer & dryer Hair dryer, iron & ironing board Panel heating/fans Single foam mattress foldaway bed for 3rd guest Check-in from 3.00pm/check-out 10.00am Maximum 3 guests Approx 43 sq m The
neighborhood_overview: Elwood is located by the bay right next to vibrant St Kilda and upmarket Brighton. A top location with Ormond Road Village at your doorstep and also the beach at the end of the street. On offer are boutiques, bookstore, deli, grocery stores and supermarket. Also cafes and restaurants are just minutes away. Enjoy The Milton, Blue Tongue and Dandelion for upmarket dining. Public transport to St Kilda and Melbourne City Centre are also only minutes walk away. With local shopping and dining at your doorstep, this apartment is the perfect choice for your next Melbourne getaway!
notes: First floor apartment without lift access,  No air conditioning. Heaters/fans only. Permissible sized hot water tank that requires time to reheat water between use, especially between showers. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located right in the heart of Ormond Road Elwood Village with everything literally at your doorstep and the beach just down the road. For travelling further afield, bus stops are located only meters away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: Collingwood 2 bedrm Warehouse Apt
summary: Spacious 2 bedroom warehouse apartment with high ceilings in the heart of Collingwood, 1 minute walk to Smith street, trams, supermarket, cafes, restaurants and bars etc. 10 minutes into Melbourne City by tram. Parking available right out front with a parking permit provided.

transit: The tram stop is 1-2 minute walk from the front door. the 86 tram takes you straight into the heart of Melbourne City in about 10 minutes. or to the Southern Cross station. getting to the apartment from the Airport is easiest by taxi if there is more than 1 person, this usually costs about $60-65.  If you're on a budget you can catch the sky bus to Southern cross station ($18 one way, $30 return per person) and then catch the 86 tram towards Bundoora RMIT, exit at stop 18 (Next to Woolworths supermarket)  keep in mind, you will need to have a prepurchased Myki card to travel on public transport. (we have 2 cards available to borrow)

My husband and I work in the fashion industry.

name: Sunny 2BR Melbourne flat 7kms CBD
summary: Bright, sunny second floor flat in Northcote/Thornbury (a very cool neighbourhood just 7kms from city) with two bedrooms, separate kitchen and light spacious lounge. Just steps away from tram and train to get to CBD in 20 mins. Sleeps up to 5 people.
space: Bright, sunny second floor flat in Northcote/Thornbury (a very cool neighbourhood just 7kms from city) with two bedrooms, separate kitchen and light spacious lounge.  The apartment is equipped with a washing machine and there is unlimited wifi.  The apartment is a very cosy, comfortable space with lots of light and everything you need for a stay in Melbourne, and most importantly it is spotlessly clean! Even if you're only using it as a place to crash after a day of sightseeing, you want to know you're relaxing in a clean place with freshly laundered linen on the beds and soft towels in the bathroom. Being a 2-bedroom flat, it is best suited to groups of up to four. However, I can arrange a fold-out single bed and linen (and additional towels if required) for a fifth person at a cost of $18/night.  I'm also very family friendly, having a child of my own, and love having families stay. The only thing that I ask is that you are mindful of the close proximity of neighbours when it comes t

neighborhood_overview: Before all the hipsters moved in (just joking! We love hipsters!) Thornbury has historically been home to many Greek-Australians and Italian-Australians, so there are a plethora of great deli's and food stores. Now they sit comfortably alongside hip cafes, bars, health food stores and music venues, mostly along High St, which is just a few minutes walk.  The flat is walking distance to these great sights and attractions: CERES Community Environment Park - a Community park and garden with a nursery, organic market, cafe and mini farm plots Merri Creek bike and walking path - takes you on a scenic route to the city without needing to ride / walk on the road Wesley Anne bar, eatery and live music venue  Psarakos fruit & vege market - cheap fruit, veges, meat and fish only 10 minutes walk away Thornbury Theatre - live music venue Northcote Social Club - a great pub with good meals and a place to see some of Melbourne's finest bands
transit: Croxton Train Station (on the Epping line, also called the South Morang line) is 300m East and will take you to the CBD (Flinders Street Station) in 19 mins. For footy fans, you can get to the famous MCG in 14 minutes by train! Tram stop (Route 112) is 300m west, taking you directly to Brunswick St (Fitzroy) in 12 mins, Melbourne CBD in 22 mins and St Kilda in 50 minutes.  Tram stop (Route 86) is 500m east, taking you down High St (Northcote) in 5 mins, then to Smith St (Collingwood) in 15 minutes and into the CBD in 25 mins. Off street parking is available for one car.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment exclusively for their own use. They also can access a shared space at the back of the block where there are a number of shared clotheslines. They can also use the shared laundry on the ground floor, which has coin-operated clothes drier and washing machine. NB. The apartment is equipped with its own washing machine.
interaction: I like to leave my guests to enjoy their stay in Melbourne without interfering too much.  I'll be in touch in the days leading up to your arrival to confirm what time you'll check-in. Late night check-ins are no problem. I'm available 24/7 on my mobile and email if there are any problems. I will then stay in touch via the odd text message or phone call to make sure everything is going smoothly.
house_rules: Complying with the following House Rules is a requirement for permission to enter and occupy the Property.  4.1 General requirements a) Guest and Visitors must comply with all House Rules and instructions from the Host during their stay; and b) Guests must notify the Host of any disputes or complaints from neighbours as soon as is practicable. 4.2 Noise and Residential amenity a) Guests and Visitors must not create noise which may disturb neighbours, especially between 9pm - 8am and during arrival and departure at any time throughout the occupancy; b) Offensive noise is prohibited and may result in termination of your stay, loss of rental paid and extra charges for security and other expenses which may be deducted from your deposit;  c) Guests and Visitors must not engage in anti-social behaviour and must minimise their impact upon neighbours and local community. 4.3 Visitors a) As the apartment is not large, and is in close proximity to neighbours, no more than two Visitors are permit
host_about:
Shaun is a social worker and a musician and Lanie works in communications. We're from Melbourne, Australia.

We love Melbourne for all it's good things (coffee, shopping, cultural diversity and live music) and all it's one bad thing (unpredictable weather).

We rent out our 2-bedroom flat in Melbourne and love to let our guests in on the little secrets that turn them from a tourist into a traveller.

Things we can't live without: sunshine, books, family, fish'n'chips on the beach in summer.

As an airbnb guest, I will look after your place like its my own.

name: Victorian terrace in Nth Melbourne close to CBD!
summary: Victorian terrace near Melbourne CBD, mins walk to Errol St, Queen Vic Market and all Melbourne has to offer; cafes, restaurants, shops, flagstaff gardens, public transport, the list goes on...  A clean & cosy bedroom with ornate fireplace, drawers & BIRs. House features polished floorboards, high ceilings, leading to an open plan living /dining kitchen area, facing rear courtyard. Bathroom with basin, bath, stand up shower and toilet. European style laundry with washing machine.
space: A great place to stay close to amazing cafes, restaurants & the eclectic nightlife. Close to the city; only 5mins by tram to the CBD, minutes walking distance to Queen Victoria market and Errol St shopping precinct. Easy access to the City, Brunswick, Fitzroy & Southbank either by public transport, uber or bicycle ride. We are also close to the beautiful Flagstaff gardens, a major public park, only 10mins stroll for the fitness conscious. ;) Room: medium sized bedroom with two BIRs in a light and airy space right in the heart of North Melbourne. Features include original ornate fireplace & high ceilings, vintage style chest of drawers.   The two bedroom workers cottage/single story terrace is shared with myself; Chloe. :) Host: I'm friendly, open minded, creative individual, happy to chat or direct you to local places worth visiting on your stay. I'm very social but also endeavour to make your stay as "stress free" & easy as possible. Note: This is a LGBT friendly home.  The Area: With

neighborhood_overview: North Melbourne is an inner suburb of Melbourne, Australia, 2 km north-west of Melbourne's Central Business District. Its local government area is the City of Melbourne. North Melbourne is bounded by the CityLink freeway to the west, Victoria Street to the south, O'Connell and Peel Streets to the east and Flemington Road to the north. Formerly known as Hotham, it was essentially a working class area, with some middle class pockets and was one of the first towns in Victoria to be granted Municipal status. Today it continues to undergo gentrification, noted for its Victorian architecture, cosmopolitan demographic, commercial and older industrial areas.
notes: Non smokers only! No parties or loud music/ happenings after 9pm. No visitor stays during bookings. All guests are expected to keep communal areas tidy. It is a requirement of your stay that you are friendly and respectful towards host. No exceptions.
transit: You never need a car or worry about getting around. Close to train, tram, bus routes, this is one of the best areas for getting around via public transport. Whether into the city or off on an adventure, everything you can think of is in close proximity & in most cases just a stroll away.
access: Access all communal areas of the house, apart from the master bedroom.
interaction: Always available to offer directions, local knowledge & advice. If you need help finding where to eat, shop, drink, socialise, get ready or get fit, I will be able to share with you local knowledge.
house_rules: No Smoking inside or in the courtyard. No Pets allowed. Please clean up after yourself in kitchen after cooking & in bathroom. Cleanliness is next to godliness in this house & slobs won't be tolerated. Guests will be given a set of two keys on arrival.  It is your responsibility to keep them secure. In the case of lost keys; you will be required to pay for their replacement at a cost decided at the hosts discretion.     If Guests would like to bring friends to the residence, you must ask first / or let me know well in advance. (No randoms) Also Visitors are just that "visitors", they won't be able to stay over, sorry guys.  Please keep noise to a minimum before 10am & after 10pm. If you need new towels or would like help with something, just let me know, as I'm happy to help out. I ask that anyone make sure they have all their belongings & leave their room in a somewhat tidy manner on check out.  Failure to comply with any of the house rules will incur additional fees (additional to se
host_about:
Hi there, I'm Chloé! :)
A friendly and very accommodating host, happy to share with you my very neat & eclectic styled home; my local knowledge on great places to go, explore & visit will be all yours. Also I'll endeavour to help with directions so you can navigate around Melbourne's city with ease. :)

I enjoy meeting new & interesting people from all over the world.
I love chocolate! I love to display flowers at home and think pets are adorable- (hopefully you like cats?) I'm a mother of a two fur babies: Bella, 2y.o black & white tuxedo girl who is playful, curious and loves to welcome new guests! Then there's Tinka, a shy little old tabby rescued from the street life; she is shy, calm & affectionate in small doses. Happy to chat with guests about the area, life n such but generally do my own thing.

Enjoy the many restaurants in Melbourne- there are some good ones, and some great ones! I love my local area, here we have everything just a short stroll away.
Other then that, you'll find both a comfortable place to stay & a very friendly host. Look forward to meeting you! ;)

house_rules: Placement Parking Permit - $100 AUD Replacement Keys - $100 AUD Apartment is kept & returned in the same condition as check in Please respect our neighbours and neighbourhood Have fun & recommend us to your friend and family
host_about:
Hi I’m Jack,

My wife Stacey and I have some amazing places in Melbourne and the Yarra Valley that we'd love to share with you. 

We have a stunning (circa 1854) converted stables in St Kilda, which is very close to Fitzroy and Acland Streets, the beach and many awesome cafes and restaurants and the Albert Park Formula One circuit. We have two stunning Art Deco apartments in the Botanic Garden’s precinct in Melbourne, which are close to the best of everything that Melbourne is famous for – shopping with Chapel St (South Yarra), Toorak Rd (South Yarra) & Bridge Rd (Richmond) all within walking distance to the best sports grounds in Australia including the MCG, Australian Open Tennis Arena, Melbourne Formula 1 Grand Prix and CBD all within 2 klms. South Yarra and the CBD have many of the best bars and restaurants and in typical Melbourne style you’ll have to scour the backstreets and laneways to find them.

Healesville Country House is our beautiful 5 bedroom home in the Yarra Valley, it is a former guesthouse circa 1900 that we've lovingly restored and created a family home from. We are two minutes from the main street and 5-10 minutes from some of the world's best wineries. It is the perfect place for unwinding with plenty of outdoor spaces including a pool and verandahs boasting some of the best views around.

Check out our profile for additional information and pictures. We're really happy to recommend our favourite restaurants, cafes and places to see. 
  
About us - I’m work with the best and brightest Australian technology and digital start-ups to help them become successful through investment and mentoring. Stacey is in the Fashion Industry and travels the world promoting emerging Australian brands to the rest of the world. We love everything about Melbourne, meeting new people, and travelling as much as we can – we are now eager to use AirBNB for all of our trips and hope to meet some of you through the process.

name: In The Heart Of The City- Melbourne
summary: Fully Furnished and includes all utilities and wifi internet.
space: Originally from Melbourne I now live in the US and rent out my apartment fully furnished on a permanent basis.  You won't find any of my personal belongings in the apartment, however it is equipped with everything you could possibly need for your stay. Located on Little Collins Street and with everything at your doorstep, this is the perfect location to base yourself at to explore Melbourne. You are in the heart of it all, with public transport just at the end of the street, not that you'll need it as you can walk pretty much everywhere. The apartment is on a fairly quiet street and the bedroom has noise reduction windows so you won't be blasted by city noise. The apartment is best suited to a single person or a couple, but is not suitable for kids or pets. For more information please feel free to message me. About the Apartment • Accommodates 2 persons in a queen bed. • Non smoking. • Reverse cycle Air conditioning for heating and cooling. • Spacious living areas with large windows •

neighborhood_overview: You truly are in the heart of the city.
notes: Please note:  The apartment is run to cover its costs not make a profit. I'm afraid I can't give discounts for short stays however the monthly rate does reflect a discounted rate. I give preference to longer bookings those for 1 month +, it is much easier to manage fewer tenants. In most cities I find there is a shortage of affordable mid-term accommodation that is affordable and doesn't require a real-estate agent. This apartment is primarily intended to service those who need accommodation for longer that a hotel stay. That being said feel free to request shorter bookings a month prior to your intended stay.
transit: Yes, trams are just at the end of the street, train a 5min walk.
access: There are no amenities: pool, gym etc. in this building
interaction: Prior to arrival and departure. And of course if you have an issues.
house_rules: Arrival Instructions: You will received the apartment keys when you are met at the apartment at the pre-arranged time. Depending on your arrival and depature time you will need to co-ordinate with the person letting you in. It may not be possible to if you are arriving between the hours of 10pm and 8am. Make sure you have the funds available (see Money Matters). Money Matters: Payments are made through Airbnb. NO personal cheques, NO credit cards, NO traveller cheques. All utilities are included except phone calls. The phone may be used to make local and international calls at a charge. If you do use the phone the calls will be charged at the end of your stay deducted from your security deposit. Apartment Door Keys: There are two sets of keys available. One set will be given to you on arrival and the other set is available on request. A note about the door lock: When you leave the apartment, always check that the keys are in hand and then lock from the outside. This is to protect your
